Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	The text appears to be a medieval medical treatise written in a language that is somewhat similar to Latin, Italian, Spanish, and French
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	I have given you the completion of this book, which is the science of medicine, in praise of the physician who made it, and through his examples, and his statements, I see that you comprehend this well to yourselves in this treatise, which is a part of the operation which I call surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	The first source sentence translates to: "However, the operation is performed on our territory and in our time with complete privacy, as soon as I deemed it necessary due to the science of the matter and the witness of it being left; and I did not want to describe it in any way in the books of the ancients, which would have been too long for the sense of the matter and the art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	It is observed to me that you are alive in this order of this treatise on the second way of exposure and declaration, and for the reason that it comes in the forms of the tools of cauterization and of other instruments of the work as it is for the addition of the declaration, and for the preparation of it, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The cause for which the artificer is not able to make the arm as it should be in that time, is that the art of medicine is long and that the actor does not know this to be exercised in the science of anatomy which Guillaume entered after knowing the properties of the members and their shapes, and the connection and separation of them; and had knowledge of the bones, nerves, and ligaments, and their number, and their kind; and of the pulsating veins and quiet ones, and of the locations of the inflammation of the same.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	For that reason, Iocaras says that he is named with a small book, but mainly in the art of medicine.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have not yet said anything about that in the beginning of this book; for what we have said about anatomy is not known to many, and if it is not well done, many men die because of it, as you have seen many of them, who are formed in this science and get their knowledge from that science and its experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	You saw a surgeon fold his hand and had experienced an abscess in the chest of a woman, and had incised some arteries of the chest so that great blood flowed out when the woman died between the shoulders of him.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	When another physician saw that the patient was suffering from a stone in the bladder, which had been processed in his state, and the stone was large, and it came out of the patient and was squeezed on the other side of the water, so that that man died the next day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And you had called for help to remove that, and you saw that because of the large size of the stone and the position of the thighs under him that would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another physician who took payment from a duke of our land for surgery, and went to a black cradle which was made for the fracture in the thigh; and the physician, being ignorant, treated the fracture, over the plague, with pulvinars and estellas, and did not let the plague escape.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And it follows the rules of the doctors, and the relief, and the relief according to the number of days and commands that we unwind the limb; and I saw that the thigh and the foot were forged, and it came out in loss.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	When you called for me and appeared, I quickly undressed you and managed to achieve calm and ease in alleviating your pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, I already confirmed that the corruption had spread to the member, so I could not stop it and had to continue spreading the corruption throughout the thigh pericardium.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	I saw another doctor who performed an abscess on the cancer patient, and it ulcerated after a few days, because the malice of the lord of the body was revealed.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of this pain is that the cramp is caused by melancholic humor, and it does not matter if it has been infused into the lord of the body, but rather that the member which suffers has been harmed by all.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	Therefore, children, it is necessary for you that the operation be performed in two stages: one is in the operation associated with health, and the other is in the work that is held in the larger dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already existed in this free place where the operation was performed in which error and fear were committed; therefore, it is necessary for you to guard that and lay that aside, so that the children do not fall into speaking and with you being unjust.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	When you prepare your weapons for the concern and protection of God, and your patients for their necessity and closure.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	When you use the best way through the grace of God, they are saved and praised by the succession, and you heal the most difficult diseases, and you keep your weapons ready for what frightens you, so that your faith and your name do not abandon you: four more remain in your glory, and put on earth and in others' sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Guilt has already been confessed in some of my mistakes.
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not medicate diseased patients, for if the bad ones do not rest.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	 And you have already had to write this free book three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the free book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered within the head of the foot, in the forms of the instruments and in the forces of the cauteries, and so that it is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second source sentence to translate:
Divisio de la tersa partida.	This sentence seems to be discussing the division of a certain part. Here's a possible translation: "Division of the
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	This sentence appears to be discussing the division of the third part, which is related to restoration and displacement, as well as the treatment of twisted and semblant parts. Here's a possible translation: "The third part, which is ordered from the head down to the feet, and from the forms of instruments, is divided into three parts: the first part is the head, the second part is the neck, and the third part is the trunk.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	When using cauterization with fire or in acute medical treatment and for memory of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	Is that book the whole treatise?
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I ask about the quality of the materials used for that cauterization and in what collection it is forbidden to use cauterization.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I say that the speech on the quality of the material for cauterization and the collection is long and prolix, subtle by knowledge, and secret; and many wise men have spoken about it, and they disagree with each other, and for me a little of their words is enough to fear perversion.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore, I say that cauterization comforts the whole universal collection of its material or its matter, except for two collections, which are the hollow matters of its matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the hollow and dry collection of its matter, it dries up; four others said that cauterization is used for that, and the others said the opposite, that cauterization is not convenient in illness, which is due to quality and dryness, and nature of the fire is quality and dryness, and it is not appropriate that illness be cautious and dry as it is cooked and dried to be healed.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	When one says the opposite of this, that by cauterization, it is beneficial in the entire tail of the female body and dry that appears in the chest of men, when you compare the chest of a man with his humidity to the entire fire, it harms the chest of a man.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And you say for the speech of this, that I have already experienced this with my own eyes in discovering.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But rather that comes to mind is that which has already been expropriated and exercised in the capital of cauterization for the exercise, and known the diversity of the composition of men and the disposition of the diseases in their members, and the causes of those, and their accidents, and the space of time of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But rather in other compositions, it is not about your fear, and mainly in the wet and dirty diseases, where all doctors are agreed on this, and are not discordant in the benefit of cauterization in these.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And wise sons, children, know that the secret of curing by cauterization for fire and its benefit is in cauterization for medicine, as it is simple, the fire which does not reach the member which is cauterized and does not notice the other member but only adjusts it with a little harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	When the pain reaches the joints of the body, and often it happens in the difficult-to-heal limbs, and it is not easy to alleviate, it is necessary to seek medical attention immediately.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	The fire, due to its sublimity and good substance, does not cause harm unless it is excessive. And we are known by experience and long service in the art of understanding the true causes; and for this reason you are excusated from the length of this speech, and if it were not for your free will in this moment to speak about the fire, and the quality of the operation of the heart and the expulsion of the sickness through which the sicknesses are expelled, the philosophical speech would be demonstrated, which is sharp in your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	Indeed, children, when it is convenient to cauterize and rest the best time of the day, they do not follow the time.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And you say that cauterization is convenient at all times, because the harm caused by the passage of time is submerged in the youth of that which has the cauterization, and especially if the cauterization is for pain or necessary pain, more and faster, those that do not suffer delay for so that it is feared that those that will come are malicious, which is greater than small harm entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	When there is no pain in your feet, or rather, as they say among the common people and barbers, this is because the gout that is cured by cauterization does not always heal at once, and it takes time for the consequences to appear.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	The cause is not that they are hurt for that reason, but rather because cauterization is not always effective in the place where medicine is applied, which alters the composition and dries out the humors that cause the pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	However, cauterization is often used over medicine because of its great value and the virtue of its operation and the greatness of the Lord's servant.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that the disease may return at some time, according to the composition of the disease and its location in the body, as well as the virtue of the patient, and that which is prepared in the heart of the patient from the addition of superfluities in the patient, and that which has been received by the patient through his victories and similar causes; but if the disease to which cauterization is administered is a subtle disease in the member of few superfluities and humors, then it is possible that in that place the pain will not return, more so because it is small.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	This is indeed a common saying that cautery is the last resort of medicine, and it is said that it does not cure but rather profits from medicine or another cause. This means that cautery is used as a final measure when all other medical treatments have failed. It is believed that cautery does not provide a cure in itself, but rather complements or enhances the effects of other medical treatments or procedures.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	However, the cause is actually the opposite of this; and I understand that cautery is the last resort of medicine is not true unless they administer the medications for certain diseases and those medicines do not work, and at the end of the cause, it is the physician who uses cauterization to relieve the patient and profit from it. This means that cautery is only used as a last resort when other medical treatments have been tried and have failed to provide relief or improve the patient's condition. The physician then turns to cauterization as a way to alleviate the patient's suffering and potentially benefit from the procedure.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And I understand that cautery is the last resort of medicine, not second to what I understand from the common people and many of the doctors. This means that cautery is truly the final measure in medical treatment, and it is not simply a matter of tradition or popular belief. It is a well-established medical practice that is used only when all other treatments have been tried and have failed to provide relief or improve the patient's condition.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	When cutting the points with a pointed cautery, it is better to use one made of gold than iron, and do not cut it otherwise than by equality of the gold and sublimacy of its essence.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	When determining the location for cauterization, ensure it is not too close to the skin, as it may not be absolutely effective, since you have already attempted and experienced that it does not work in any other part of the body except for this one, and cauterization is better than a surgical knife; however, when performing cauterization, use gold instead of iron, as it is more suitable for the intensity of the gold, and prepare the receiving freg; and if you adjust over the ignition, the gold may pierce the skin, and there may be some layers in the focus that the artificer will use for this purpose.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And therefore, cauterization with iron should be made lightly and carefully in the direction of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And you have already ordered this capital in cauterization according to the other capitals, and ordered those of the foot within the feet, so that the patient can ask for what he wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Cauterization for head pain due to coldness and wetness.
Le capitol primier.	The first capital.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers humidity and coldness upon the accident that caused it, causing soda and multitude of rheumatic fluxes, called corissa, from the head to the parts of the wings and eyebrows, and multitude of sleeping, and toothache and gout, and universally of all maladies that appear due to coldness, which are paralyzed, sore, and apoplexy, and seem similar in those maladies.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is this, which initially commands the thigh that the evacuated waste from the unclean part of the body, for three or four times, according to what is required by the virtue of the thigh and the age of the person and their custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And how do you command that the razor cuts, and how do you place that on your thighs over a low chair and that places your hands over the chest you want?
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And place your hand on the razor's edge, placing the point of the razor on the nose of the person you want to cut.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, as the previous sentence said, mark that location, and then ignite the olive oil cauterization, and this is the form of it:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And place that on the marked location, with your hand descending, which is tightened little by little, and you rotate that.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And take your hand lightly and look at the location, and if you see any part of the bone exposed in any amount of the head, then according to the quantity of errors, raise your hand, and if not turn your hand on that iron, on another of that, if it is cold, enter that as you have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And take a small amount of salt and dissolve it in that place and stir it three times.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And stop on the border that is begging to be cut and stir it over there when the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And cure the place with an anointing tetrafarmacon when it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And it has been said that when the Roman plague opens the bowel, so much honey gets into the breast, because it is better and less harmful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they advise those who have the tail cauterized within the bone, and it is held by the cauterization until it is swollen in any part of the spinal column.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And let it be known that this remedy adheres to the bone and its cure.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And they advise others that the cauterization goes to the bone and its remedy is as follows: when it is applied with force to the bone, if it presses hard on the bone and the bone breaks, this is the form of alphecati petit:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	 They estimate that the vapors of the head will escape from that place.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	If the wound is held for a long time and is cured within the time it has solidified.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I have not seen these kinds of cauteries used on anyone before, except in cases of fear; and if that is the case, you must, for your health's sake, do it as soon as possible, when the head is divided by a solution of continuity of the vessel, which has been observed in other parts, and particularly when the head of the foot is of natural nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first kind of cauterization is not as safe and you should do it; and from that, for your health's sake, it is better to do it.
Capitol segon.	Chapter second.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of head cauterization.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When throughout the head there is chronic and long-lasting pain, and it is prolonged in the foot, and used are needles, thorns, purgatives, plasters, ointments, candles, and wax, and especially if it has already been cauterized with a cautery that has not given way to the cause, you should consider whether the head of the foot is of great creation in its nature; and if it does not bleed much, you should cauterize it with another cauterization afterwards.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	When it is necessary to make points on the surface of the thigh, then do so with a pointed cautery.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Incise the coda and expose the bone to reveal the quantity that has been found, and cauterize it with a cautery at the tip of the head in the area called the "V" and place your hand there to keep it warm.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And then take your hand away, and do not discover the bone, for the thigh suffers from a different kind of pain than the pain from all other cap cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And you direct this cauterization to its place, where it is said that this cauterization is used for the cauterizations of the thighs and the occiput, and a subtle cauterization is made on that part of the head; and this is the form of it.
Capitol ters.	Chapter ends.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of ancient non-analogous cauterization.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When the pain in the front of the head becomes severe, or if there is a sharp pain in the wrist, it should be removed by medicine from the head, and the other cure should be administered according to the diseases you have mentioned; and this should not be neglected, cauterization can be made in two ways: either with acute medicine that burns, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	May cauteries be used in medicine, as you take a heated pin, and press around those areas of the wounds, covering them with something to prevent infection.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And if you find the location of the pain in the temple, use a sharp needle and enter it where the pain is located, entering it as far as it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And press firmly on the affected area with a cloth, and leave it for three hours; then take off the cloth and treat the wound with two or three times a day, and return to the area submerged in water when the place is sore.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And cure that as soon as it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	If you see, use some burning medicines that you have written in the book of burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	The use of cauterization is followed by this method: iron for cauterization, and this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	It is called a clamp clavicle, where the top of the wound is shaped like a thorn in which there is a curve, and in the middle part of the wound it is slightly eminence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And place your hand over the painful location, and pull out the small bell slowly - so as not to tear the artery that is left - and roll the small bell little by little at high speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	If the quantity of blood that is consumed by the part of the spine that you have opened, and it is raised up, then raise your hand but not so much that the artery is not raised up, so that no flow of blood comes out.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And if you happen to have a piece of copper in water and place it on the area, and leave it there for three days; and then place a piece of cloth around the border, and take care not to expose it to any moisture.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	If you see, make a point at the end of the thigh using a cautery, and watch for an incision in the artery in this unusual part properly.
Capitol quart.	Capitol quarter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of ancient emigrant cautery.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you cure the ancient emigrant by the treatment that has been said of the previous cure, and what has been said in the divisions of the diseases, and do not take advantage of the cure, and sometimes for the disease that does not suffice to the first cauterization of medicine or the cauterization of fire, you will see that you cut the thigh with the cauterization tool at the location of the pain, or wherever it is; and then stop your hand for a while and press it over the incision in the artery and pass it through the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	The first source sentence translates to: "However, it is necessary for you to guard against the continuation of the mandible, which is harmed by chewing, and that the tail does not become enlarged and the nerves that cause that, and that it does not expand too much.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	If it is about the custody and caution of the flow of sand from the artery that is blocked, then in the abscess of the same it is feared, and mainly to that which ignorantly does what he does not study and does not practice; and therefore the operation is started on the same.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you will come to remember the regimen of the flow of sand in case of an accident to the artery according to the right hand, in the place where this is located.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	E si you see of this malady that does not satisfy this cautery and see the course of the wound tolerable, cauterize it in the same place as the head of the thigh has been cut, and cure the plague when it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	E if you see, maintain the cauterization that has been said in the capital of stretching of the artery with an increase of two points, and this cauterization is better than the previous one and gives less pain.
Capitol .v.	Capital.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of the cauterization of the pains of gout.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the gout there is pain in the foot due to swelling and it is cured by treating the causes locally and by the other treatment that I have said in the division, and the pain does not worsen, then you must cauterize, and this is the one that is called a point, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	When making a point on the nail, and it is to be placed at the circumference of the entire toe as the nail rotates, or in the circuit of any part if the pain is in that part.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	After applying the cautery to the toe, there will be fewer and fewer blisters that will eventually reach the intended location.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery points are made all over the toe, and it is taken care of, and the affected areas are cared for, they will eventually be healed.
Capitol .vi.	End of volume VI.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of cauterization of burns.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Burns that are cured and treated with cauterization are not the same as those caused by scars, according to what has been said in the sections of the diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization for sclerosis or spasm of the nerves.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you cure the burned part with jewelry, gauze, and bandages, and do not comfort your cure, you have to cauterize the toe three times: the first time is the tip of the toe, the second time a small piece of cloth is placed there to hold it in place, and the third time the conjunctiva of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	When stopping the hot iron for the opposite side of the affected part, it does not seem to have any effect on the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cauterization is that you cauterize the tip of the extremity of the swollen nose with a small piece of the corn of the head, and on the other side, the length of which is equal to the length of the same part, and then your hand is placed there until it is burned by the amount of the tumor of the affected vertebra.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the method of cauterization, and it is specific to the surgeon, the form of which is shown on the table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it seems that this is a small point that few people understand; and indeed, it is superfluous to add too much detail on this matter.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the area with what is indicated in the process when it is healthy.
Capitol .vii.	Capitol, Volume VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On the cauterization of ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When ancient apoplexy occurs and is treated as follows and does not confirm your medicine and the patient's thighs do not have fever, then you should cauterize that part four times: on all parts of the head; and cauterize and the hand of the patient, as they have said; and cauterize in the groin.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	The manicure of the cautery is made according to the size it has been cut.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized on the entrance of the stomach; and it is lesser; and it is necessary that you proceed with care.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	For the cauterization of oblivion, a flat one is made.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Cover them with large and small pills to make the vagina comfortable.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And rub the whole of the vagina and stop on the inside of its wall, as described in the chapter of the plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And stop those veins, as much as possible, and that is the manicure of the cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to the order that has already been said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if for those who are sick, it is; and otherwise, make three cauterizations on the same side of your head, which are coming from the side of the forehead to the side of the chin.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And stop between each cautery the largest part of the said, and proceed with care to the cautery as it has been said.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	If the patient's thigh is tolerable, then make the cautery on the inner side of the thigh; and if there is more addition, make the cauterization on both sides.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Proper care for that part that is to be healed; and let the cauterization be olive-shaped according to the given form.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of cauterization of thorns and mollification of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Cover that you process in the head's molding and according to what has been said; and take the head of the thigh, and make cauterization on the inner side of the thigh, and make cauterization on all sides of the head, and make cauterization on the opposite part of it, and make three cauterizations on the vertebrae of the hip.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the mollification of the body of too much and the tolerant thighs and the thigh is strong, then make cauterization on that with four cauterizations on the vertebrae of both sides, and afterwards make cauterization inside where it is crushed by the hamstring of the leg, and elevate the other leg.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	When treating that which is healthy, and this is olive oil cauterization.

De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of cauterization for epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	It is not cauterized the epileptic except that epilepsy is by fleecing.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore you modify the brain of him at the beginning of his youth and at the other treatment that they have ordered in the division when the thigh is large and tolerates the exception of the medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is an infant who did not tolerate the medicines, then administer guarguarissmes and mastiguatoris to modify the serum, and this for several days, for the benefit of the wounds.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And cut the head of the thigh, and then cauterize that with a cauterization in the previous location of the head, and another cauterization on the occiput of him, and over each corn of the head you can cauterize.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the thigh is strong and tolerates, then cauterize that with the ones I have mentioned, having paralyzed and softened the body over the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	When the cauterizing oil is applied, it should be followed by...
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	If the patient is young, then stop cauterizing with this delicate method.
Capitol .xi.	Capitulum XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Chapter on Cauterization for Melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are humid and corrupted, and have become very large and flaccid, then cauterize those parts with the cauteries that have been mentioned for paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is superfluity and declines into melancholy, and the thighs of the patient are wet, then give him this remedy to purify the brain after that which was given before in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And shave the head of the patient, and make a small round cut, and place that over the top of the head, and tie it down in that location of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient's head is sixty years old, and he is held by all parts.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And place the liniment; and it is worthy of being bound with ancient woolen threads.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	When you heat that over the fire with gentle heat, the one who suffering from it feels relief when they are in it.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And you want that over the top of the head of the patient in the circle, and you should let him go in until he is warm.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And you apply this to the thigh once a week for a few days, or in the other regimen of the patient when he is cured; or if you prefer, cauterize those points as small as possible, but make sure you have the order of an attentive cauterist: this is a specific type of cauterization that hydrates the brain with equality.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And you stop that hair from being wet or damp.
Capitol .xii.	Capital, Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of the cauterization of water that comes down in the heel.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you are declared that water has come down in the heel by the senhals which I have told you in the division, you begin and give in the buttock to the patient what is necessary to moisten the head of the patient, and hold that with all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then command that the head be shaved, and cauterize that part with the pointed cautery in the middle of the scalp; and cauterize that part with two cauters on two temples if the commencement of urine is in two waters, or on one temple if the commencement of urine is in one water.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cauterize all the veins and arteries that are left behind the codpiece; and these cauterizations are to be made in that point on the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And keep watch for the flow of salts when cauterization is performed; and if you see the flow of salts or any medicine, keep it for your own use.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And when you come to know which is extracted from the arteries and the abscess of those and the caution of the flow of salts, then...
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes a few bones are cauterized in the neck, with two cauterizations produced on each side.

De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	I apologize, but the provided text is still not in a recognizable language. It seems to be a mix of Latin, Italian
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears of the eyes are old and cause inflammation in the veins and arteries that are located in the forehead area and it is observed that there are many wrinkled flaccid vessels, then cauterize those points with a pointed cautery that have been found in the eye of water coming from the eyes, and cauterize in the middle of the forehead and cauterize on two temples and on two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	If you require an addition, then make points along the entire length of the gallbladder above the small nail on the extremity of the protruding part.
Capitol .xiiii.	Capitol, Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of cauterization for the smell of the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you are treating that which has been said in the division and does not benefit from your treatment, then you should show yourself and give to the patient's thighs three blows with a cushion; and then cut off the head of it, and cauterize the small nail with the larger nail.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize that small nail with the large nail on the two extremities of the hair, leaving a small one.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And keep from the arc that you did not burn that one.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And of this cauterization, this is the form.
Capitol .xv.	Capitol, Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of cauterization for the softening of the eyelids of the toes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the toe is softened by poor care or moisture, then you should cauterize that eyelid with a cauterization of this kind; and this is the form of it:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	If you, make incisions on that side of the two fleshy parts with a small sharp cut, and let the ends of the tendons be long.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each incision should be according to the size of the fleshy part.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	Do not press too hard with your knife, but according to the size of the fleshy part that is being cut.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of cauterizing the eyelid of the cat when the whiskers are converted into parts of flesh and finger.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the whiskers of the cat are converted into parts of flesh and finger, cauterize at those points with two knives, either one or a burning iron or a medicinal iron.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you cauterize with fire, command the patient to look at his whiskers as they are, comparing them to those of a man, and if the finger is prolonged and twisted, then you must stretch the hairs of the cat with a needle so that it is not broken when those whiskers are born.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	When newborns and infants start to cry, it is necessary to stop the mouth of the child in the middle of the nose, and then cover the eyes of the baby's face with a cloth, and hold it until the sign of death appears on the baby's face, and this is the beginning of the action of the doctor.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then stop cutting the hair in the scalp or on the neck with scissors or tweezers, and shave the beard if necessary.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Then use the cautery of which this is the form of it.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize over the figure that you have covered, little by little, in circular motions, until the surface of the skin is charred like a candle, completely apparent actually.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And the sign of health of the second work is that you see the eyelid of the face already closed and the eyes of the baby raised, you have to make the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and leave it there for three minutes, and then cover the hair that borders it until the scar is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	When treating that wound, enter it if it is healthy.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	If the eye returns to its normal position due to any cause and the eyelid is softened, then make another cut with the cautery on that same spot as before.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	If the eyelid is inside the eye, then make the cut on the side that is raised to the natural location and is engaged and does not push the tears out.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	If the cautery is used in medicine as you command on the thigh that the eyelid enters and is prolonged and engaged, and it should be made in the form of a mirror's edge, then it is appropriate to make it with a piece of paper.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And take a piece of cloth and soak it in live coals. And, or rather, and mix those causes with it, and make it into a paste for the purpose that it may not be frozen; and expand that over the paper that is made in the form of a mirror's edge, and place it over the other eye; and place the other eye on the album page, and the cap of the thigh should be at the top.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	When the doctor pauses about the medicine and asks if the patient feels the taste of the medicine, which taste is in the mouth as if from fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	Then, when the patient perceives this intense taste, the doctor will give the medicine and ask for water; then, when the taste stops, the doctor will wash the mouth with water and consider if the eye has been washed with water as it should be with vinegar or with lemon juice, which is pleasant; and if not, he will return to the medicine at the location where it has not been applied yet and has not been damaged by your operation and has not contracted the cold.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then, he will stop shaving around the area where the wound is and care for it with ointment or another substance to make it heal.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	It is necessary for you to ensure that your operation guards against neglectful diligence in the eye and if the eyelid is swollen every day and some cause of the pits in the eye is in the eyelid, you must repeat your medicine over that location where the eyelid is swollen, and as you did at the beginning, and if it becomes healthy.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the form of fuelha of magic.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	You know that the joints of men vary according to size and thickness, and therefore, according to this, your contraction is made.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not assume that the path of rectification is towards that which is being studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Capitol, Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of the cauterization of the fistula that is in the lacrimal of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you cure the fistula as they have said in the divisions of the diseases and do not confirm your cure, then you should cauterize according to this manner: command the disease that pauses the cap in the upper part, and hold the cap of it between the upper parts in such a way that it is not rough nor agitated by the upper part.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then pause the cauterization enfusion in the album of the wool or in the mucilage of the ptillon over the hip of him.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then ignite the cauterization that this is the form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	The which is cured, how it is formed like a cane or a pen of the voltor, from one end to the other, where the cauterization is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	If you wish, it may enter into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	If you want to be in good health as you try.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, that which is more difficult is better than the second work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And apply the fistula if it is opened, and then remove the disease and dry that part.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not opened, you open it and extract the sore from there.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And place your hand over it with the cautery that is not yet lit, and take that as the first part of the tieua, but a little of the cauterization of the hole in the nose so that you do not err and the thigh is quiet, and you place the cauterization on the gray of the hole and corrupt it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And if at the beginning of the cauterization it enters into the bone, then so be it; and if not, you repeat the cauterization one or two times, if it is skilled; and let that stay for three days, and place your hand over it with a border and turn it until it is dry inside that it is cured.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If it has been passing several days and the patient is not getting better, you should stop using the acute, corrosive medical treatment and wait until the bone is discovered and is smooth according to the capital's custom.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	Another way to make a cauterization of the fistula: go to the location of the fistula and then pause at that small opening in the subcutaneous tissue where the form of the fistula is; and put in there the quantity of one and an eighth drop of pus fundut; and then apply your hand on the thigh with good retention, and do not hurt the patient because the pus fundut does not reach the hole of that; and cover that with albumin or water, four drops of pus adhere to the location of the fistula and heal it for the meravilhora sanacio.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	If the fistula is healed as they have said about cauterization and cure, then so be it; and if not, you must administer narcotics through the nose and reduce the fistula to the nose of the patient according to its location.

Capitol .xx.	The text you provided appears to be a medieval medical treatise
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	1. "Capitol XX" is likely a reference to a specific chapter or section in the treatise, but without more context, it's difficult to provide a precise translation.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth become loose, and they are treated with medicines but do not heal, then place the corner of the mouth over the wound in the middle of the face, and approximately ignite the cauterization in the form that will best suit you, as if you were pressing the tooth against the cheek and enter the cauterization quickly, and then take a small piece of paper that the mouth covers the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth to become heated.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And take your hand, and iterate the cauterization on some points according to what you want.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And let the patient hold their mouth with salty water for an hour and see if it holds, and then check if the loose tooth is closed and the gum is strengthened and the corrupted humidity is dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Capitulum xxi.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of cauterization for tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is caused by coldness, or it is frozen, or vermifuge, or the medicine does not cure, then you should cauterize on that spot with two hands: either with the cauterization of cowhide, or with the cauterization of fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	If you do not know how to make the incision, take some pieces of cow or beef and cut them into strips, then fold them over the end of the nail, and press that piece against the painful part firmly until it stops bleeding.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And if you go further, it may reach the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	If you go further, place wool or a knife on the edge of that, and press it against the painful tooth, and press it against that burning iron when it reaches the edge of the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, cauterization of the foot is that you attend to the wound or iron, and it is in the body of some flesh and the sharpness of the iron does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And if you light the cauterization in that form, and press it against the tooth and put your hand in it when it is hot; and make some observations of how the pain remains or on that day or the next day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	When the pressure of that cauterization makes the wound close and hold it for an hour and remove the cauterization, this is the form of the cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	When you see that the end of the point is close to your hand, then heat it with fire.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	This is the form of the cannula:
