Capitol lvi.	Capitulum LV.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	Chapter LVI of the Book of Cauterization of the Flow of Scars from an Accidental Incision by an Archectomy.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Too many warts have flowed from the archaectomy that was made by the plague, which deformed it, or you must make an incision of the stitch or cauterization of the member, and then it seems to improve, and it is difficult to maintain that.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	When one has an attack of gout, you should cut away the skin from the affected area and place it over the opening of the artery, and hold it there until that wound is closed and the flow of blood is stopped inside that part which was formerly the course of the artery, and it will not bleed.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	Then pause in the fire the green cautery a few and large, by name, and blow over them when they are not yet hot.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	Then take from those a small or a large piece of the skin and place it over the location and press it firmly on the vessel where the affected artery was located, and then cauterize it so that it is closed and restricted to that part which was formerly the course of the artery.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	If the artery is expelled from the opening of the artery while you hold the affected part and remove the cauterization, then take another sharp cautery from those which are prepared in the fire and continue to do this until the artery is restricted.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And be careful not to burn the nerves that are here, and come over to the other side another malice.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	You know that when the artery flues, it is not possible to restrain the flow, and especially when the artery is large, it is not possible with one out of four manieyras: with one it is cauterization as it is said, with another it is extraction when it is not extracted, with four when it is extracted, the extremities of the veins are burned and the restraint of the sanc is restored, or it is liated by a fierce stretching or it is paused over the medicines of which the virtue is restricted by the sanc; and they are strengthened on the pulvinar of the constriction.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	This is the first line of the text: "Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	If there is no doctor or physician present and you are alone, then you should perform the incision on the specified site of the vein as they have said, and understand the great pressure that the wound will have on the remaining part of the plague, and on the artery, the said point is not rough; and over the artery, it is scratched with the water of great coldness that has entered when the wound is closed and compressed; and less should be thought about whether it needs cauterization or medicine.
Comensa la segonda partida.	The second part begins.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and perforation, and ventosias, and phlebitomy, and of plagues and their like.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are phrases from Albucazis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	In the first chapter of the entire malady it has been said that cauterization is convenient and necessary with medicine, and the occasions and causes of it, and the instruments used in those cases are the forms of cauterizations; and I have ordered the chapters of the subincision of the head among the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	When you process in this capital for that particular purpose, so that the client will be satisfied with it, do as follows:
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	When you begin this procedure, son, remember that in this capital there is fear for you that it is in the first capital of cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	For that reason, in this operation, which is this capital motion, it is necessary to take great care, as in the evacuation of the vein or incision over the aposteme or excision for perforation or purification of the plague or extraction of gallstones or incision of urine and its semblantz.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	When all of these symptoms accompany fear and trembling, and in the worst case, death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	You have been warned that if you do not take care of this condition, some people will use their hands on your body, which are already affected by illnesses.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And they say that if you do not go to the doctor for your illness and it worsens, and because of the severity of the illness in your body, and because the illness is in your body for a long time, then the illness will kill you.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And among those is the one who gives you hope for your life and expects a cure, and the dangerous illness is pernicious.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And do not allow yourself to be deceived by the one who shows you that illness; and your caution should be greater than your expectations and your greed; and do not assume any cause for this except for certain science that knows this, and which will be passed on in a laudable way.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the treatment of all your illnesses for prognosis and indication of the one who is healthy converted, wherein there is help for you over acquisition of fame and memory, of praise and of glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	O, children, God has given you understanding and not to direct or protect you, for this is in your own hands.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	When you order this chapter to distinguish it from the following chapters of cauterizations, for the care of the head within the feet, so that it is in accordance with your request and of the kind that has been requested.
Capitol primier.	Chapter first.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the treatment of water which is contained in the head of the child.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	You know that these movements seen in the children's disease must be given to the child and when the nurse shaves the child's head, its life will be shortened.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And some are seen because of a lack of cleaning that is not cleaned.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	I have not seen this disease but only in the children; and of all those that I saw were sick and because of this I have seen many works done on them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And you have seen that the child's head was of water and the child's head was very magnificent when it could not be covered by the large size of the child's head, and less that the moisture is increased when the fire dies.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	This humidity or is added between the ribcage and the bone, or is added behind the bones on the chest plate.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	If the humidity is between the ribcage and the bone, and the incision is small, then you must operate in the middle of the head with a fissure of two inches long, and this is the shape of the sputum:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	If the humidity increases and the incision becomes larger, then you will have two fissures according to this method:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	If the humidity is behind the bones, then you will see the fissures of the head completely open and the water will be sprayed when you touch that with your hand, but not on your fingers.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	Then you must operate in the middle of the head with three fissures according to this method:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And take the incision out of all the humidity; and tighten the fissures with cloths and plumassols; and put on over them a covering and oil every five days, and care for the wound that you make and engorge, and tighten the cap with equality; and eat the member with little humidity when it is comfortable and healthy.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	This is a medieval medical treatise written in a language similar to Latin, Italian, Spanish, and French. The text describes various medical procedures and treatments for different ailments. Here's the translation of the first source sentence:
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	You should observe that the artery is not torn and does not cause blood vessels to bleed, and the patient's leg does not swell due to this flow of sinew.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter II
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Regarding the tearing of the arteries that are called hilasses, which are located at the ankles.
Capitol segon.	Chapter Third.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When you cut the cords or wounds on the hips or chest, and it is common to do so, and no one confirms this in writing, but rather the medicine itself confirms it in this case of these two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And when you want to cut those that the patient wants, and sharpen the edge as much as possible with something hard, and strengthen the knee of the leg with a drap; and consider where the vein is; and the places of each over the places where the hips are, and so many hide them in as few people as possible.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And cover the artery that you intend to cut, and cut through each one with the sharp edge of the bone, and it will be easy to enter into the bone and be close to the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	If you wish, enter the thick mucous membrane and run it along that artery to those parts of the body.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And if the length of the incision is twice that of the distance between the two points, when a vein is incised, the sinus escapes and is easily expelled, which deformed by frequent strokes.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	If the artery does not appear in the incision, you should measure the amount of space from the three points, and approximately send it to the chest, and then enter the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And if the amount of sinus that comes out is small, and less than the amount that should be, and then it is according to the quantity that appears on the surface of the thigh and the repletion of the artery of the patient.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And if you consider the plague, and if there is any cause of inflammation on the bone, then incise accordingly so that it does not lead to the appearance of gangrene cauterization.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you strengthen the plague with plasters and bandages, and cure it so that it is healed inside when it is healthy.
Capitol .iii.	I apologize, but there seems to be an error in the
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	The translation of the line "De extraccio de las arceriales los cuals so en las templas" is: "Of the extraction of the arteries that are
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	The translation of the line "Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat." is: "When there are old and frequent anemias or catarrhs, caused by humors of a gross nature and quality in the limbs of the temples, or sudden and violent pains in those parts, and they are treated with the means of medical curacy and it does not help, we have found that the extraction of arteries in the temples, or cauterization of those parts where they have shown, has been beneficial.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	The translation of the line "E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg." is: "And the means of the operation and extraction of those are those that raze the hairs that are in the temples; and understand that the apparent artery in the temple that you see with your eyes is hidden only in a few people by the force of wind.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	If you are hidden, then the buttocks of the patient should be covered with some cloth; and around it, apply a cloth that is rough or damp with water, so that it appears to you that the urethra is clearly visible.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then take the suture material of which this is the form:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then sharpen the needle that is easy to enter into the urethra; and then get it in the intestine and extract that from the surrounding tissues from which you extract the thread of the sutures and discover those of the abdominal walls, of all parts.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	If the artery is thin, then cover that with something at its extremity, and then insert it under the skin of the thigh, and then cut off a piece according to the quantity by which they are tied at the ends of the veins and are contracted, and if it is not cut off, the wound will not heal, for if it is not cut off, the suture will not close completely.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then remove the suture from three times.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	If the urethra is large, then cover that in two places with something so that it does not fall off or with strings of long length, and do not let it be affected by putrefaction during the consolidation of the plague and turn into wounds.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	When you need to reduce the superfluity that is between two members; and do it at that time or another time.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	If you want, cauterize that point with the cautery within the bone that is causing the pain, and stay in place until that work is finished.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	It is better work if the patient does not have fever or is not suffering from an inflamed complexion; rather, cauterize those causes that help to reduce the moisture, and thus it is better for the patient's well-being.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	Cover the extraction of the arteries that supply the area of the ancient crotch, and place them over the well-dressed polls, and apply it as medicines will make the flesh and bones stronger when it is healthy.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And while you are working, if you see a flow of sinew from the artery, then you should hold that sinew, or with cauterization or with something to cover the area of the crotch, and strengthen your hand within the sinew when it is tight.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	If the cause of those is not in your present, then pause on the side about which that part is surrounded, and wet the area with a wet cloth when the sharp cold returns, and it will become stronger afterwards.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	If you are using a hot cauterizing iron, it is because you have already cauterized the vein at two points, and you have noticed the two holes, and then they will pervade the bone and indict the vein in two places, so that it is elongated as much as possible, which are not all supported by this cauterization.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	This is the form of cauterization:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And is the sharpness of the two points exemplified.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	However, if the sharpness is less than two points, that is, if it is more acute than two points and does not penetrate the flesh quickly.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, when there is any growth, the heat of the fire is applied to those and the flesh is cut off slightly.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	This work is better than any other in its kind and contains many examples.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And the spaces are between two thighs, the number of the largest part of the same.
Capitol quart.	Capitol quarter.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	Of the care for the body of acute and acidic toes.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When the toes are acute and acidic, and the body of those veins which are over the test of the head from the forehead, and do not satisfy any cause of medical cure, and sometimes the face of the thigh becomes distorted and appears in the front of ambulation as if it were the ambulation of ants, and the toes become extenuated, humid in such a way that the old ones are not as they were before, and the nails are sharp due to the acidity of tears, the ancient diseases in the cure of this operation are spaced apart, and the cure is far from them.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And it is that you command the thigh of the patient the nails which are on the front, and approximately insert three fissures in the front three times the length of the front.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	If the length of the fissure is two thirds: the first fissure is a distant engulfment along the length of the nose in the upper part of the face, and the second follows the movement of the eyelids that are in the lacrimal, and the third part of the other.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	When guarding the incision of the arteries that are in two layers, and extend your hand for the continuation of biting the mandibles.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	If the space of any incision is three times adjusted.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	If you have a sponge or cloth wrapped around it that dries the sands.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	Then insert the tip of two sharp ends, the one of which is the form of the incision of this:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which is from the division of the temples to enter into the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Excavate all the chain that is between two incisions over the bone, and if it moves to the second incision, proceed with the following:
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then insert the rest of this and enter another instrument called a scalpel, sharp on one side and blunt on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And hold the sharp side of that blade by the fat and the rest of the coden, and the leopard's claw over the bone, and press that inside where it came to the fissure, and cut off all those that descend from the head to the heels.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	When the incision is continued along this path, and it approaches the other fissure.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And push that the amount of pain increases, expose the locations of the swollen feet of the patient.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And pause in each fissure where the old hair grows thick, and place your hand on those parts that are wet with oil and vinegar, and you will see that it does not cause a sty to form.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day, remove the liquor and administer a large infusion of water or tea, and apply this to the wound which is red and pinkish and other within which the diseases are cured.
Capitol .v.	Capital.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	Of the treatment of hangnails by cutting and the lines descending from the parts where the nails are attached to the finger.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When the nail is cut and continued, and sometimes the lines of the fingertip become very small, and the eyes are affected by them, and the ulcers on the eyelids, and in the head of the finger there is sharp pain and excoriation due to this accident, you know that these things happen because the materials and nails do not come from the veins of the parts where the nails are attached.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	The best cure for this condition is to command the patient to face the wall, and then insert a small object (such as a knife or a bone) into the opening at the front of the head, starting from the left temple and moving towards the right. The object should be inserted until it reaches the skull, and the patient's mouth should be open to facilitate the process.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry completely the affected area with a sponge or cloth, and then fill it with a mixture of water and vinegar.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	Then apply a paste made of powdered herbs and oil to the affected area, so that it does not cause further irritation or inflammation.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	When you see that the apostem has diminished, apply a poultice made of powdered herbs and oil to the affected area, starting from the nayser carn and moving towards the skin. The poultice should be applied to help dry out the flesh and prevent further inflammation, as if you were mixing flour of wheat with four parts of colfen and adding water, and then making a plaster with the mixture and applying it to the affected area.

E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And if you enter it into the anus for convenience, and remove the anus of the moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	If none of the causes are forgotten, which have been reported, then you cut at that point where it is painful to touch, either for an abscess or an hernia.

The hand of the wound is that you cut at the beginning of the vein of the sephasic, extracted from the second hand of the virtue of the patient, and then make that cezer between your hands and convert the aurelha into parts of it, and for a small fissure in the edge of the aurelha, you must let out the blood in the place where it is most painful.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	If the fissure of the lunar figure is within the foot, and the foot has wasted away, remove that if you can with appropriate instruments; and at that time, cut quickly and cure it within the foot that has been healed.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	If the cause of the abscess is one of the greasy ones that have grown and are inflamed, then you administer the cure and extract it; but if you do not obey your appointment, then you should take subtle tincture according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	When administering care to that wound of that part which was caught in the thicket.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	Do not do this when you think that part has already been moistened by the steam of the thicket, and pause there for a while, and take out those with your fingers or with a gentle touch, or if you have to cut it, then it will be easier to extract it.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	In the water that was inserted in the thicket used for condiment, and fill the thicket with old cloth, and put the water on that thicket where the water is, and if for anything else you forget, then so be it; and otherwise, take a few peyrass and leons according to the length of the same, and heat them in the fire, and place one of those in the entrance of the patient's thicket and thrust it over a peice of that part and percussia am another peyra over the peyra that is dintz the thicket.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Then do not stop this until all the water is forgotten.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc i, e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	When the gout has been dried out and you have taken it with paper or cloth, and then place one end of it in the anus and extend the other end outside until it is burning and the pain of the gout has subsided.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And as many times as possible enter the vagina with a piece of cloth and a gauze, and press it against the extrauterine urethra.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha. Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	In the removal of a worm born in the anus, when you treat that worm as instructed in the division and in the treatment of distillations and do not satisfy your curiosity, keep the anus moist with the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	If here any cause of the gallstones is found, take that one by the thumb or index finger, otherwise do not take it, and if no cause is found, take a catheter and insert it into the large intestine, and this is the form of the gallbladder:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	When the extremity is gently inserted into the ear according to the amount of pain it suffers from the injury; and then apply a little of that which is suitable for relief, and make a few circular motions, until all the vermes are forced out.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	If you do not obey my instructions, then you will plead and close in the circuit of the canula as they have said; then administer distillations which have already spread the antiparasitic in the treatment of worms, and you will find it in the chapter of distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And is your effusion the one that funds the medicinal oils in the ear with this instrument of which this is the form of it:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	Make that of silver or of gold, straight, in which there is a small hole, and it will be easier to use.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And so it is when it is placed in the cavity of the canula of continence here where it may be necessary.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take the ray and gently cover the extremity of the ear with it, and place a little oil in the cavity of the ear, or from some herb, or whatever medicine you want in the canula — and that is in the ear —, and gently insert the ray into the ear and press on the other hand that one which has been compressed in the ear when the oil is expelled in the cavity of the ear and the injury feels the oil.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	When something is wrapped in the bile, it has already been burned by a small fire.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And remember that the cause which is distilled in the bile is not too impure, for it does not suffer from the bile.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of the cure of worms in the bile.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some worms are found in the intestines of older people and have been found in the intestines of men, worms in the bile caused by poison or by no meat; and this worm is found in the prey of the liver which does not feel the weather, and some are found in the deformed parts.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which happens in the prey of the liver, which does not understand the weather, is in the most difficult cases of difficult treatment.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And if you can understand the weather in that case, cover the bile of the thigh with the sun and look at that.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if you see apparent puffing, open that and sprinkle with that fine powder which is the form of this:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the extremity of the one in which the smallest latitude is, of which one part is acute and the other not; and the excretion is of two lemons per so that it does not cause discomfort to the ears.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	If warts appear on the skin or in the flesh of the foot, then you can use fine needles and apply them with great ease when there is no more flesh left.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	If warts appear on the outer part of the foot, then you can use a fine needle and heat it up a little, and then insert it into the flesh of the foot.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	If you feel that the treatment is becoming more difficult due to fatigue, try to increase the pressure on the foot; and remember not to hurt the nerves of the foot.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then stop in the foot for a while before the second amount of Egyptian oil that you have wrapped around the foot; and make sure to do this every few days when you are sure that the plague has consolidated; or if you pull out any and immerse it in water and powder it over the sore and use it from there; and if the foot becomes infected, then make sure you don't pull out the same one and replace it with another one that you wrap around the foot as red as possible, when the infection is cured; and take care of it inside to make it healthy again.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	If one has a flow of bile, submerge sponges or sheets in warm water and place them over the abdomen, and use another cure that restricts the flow of bile, which is called in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Of the treatment of conjunctivitis, which ends in the eyes.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Conjunctivitis occurs in the eyes due to certain humors, some of which are moist and some are dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, you must have those thin sheets or cloths, and cut them into strips of the desired width, and place them over the areas to be treated.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	If there is pain in the flow of bile, then you should cauterize those am cauteri lenticular subtly.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is when the incisions and wet strips are returned to the area after returning any cause of those strips; and when the cauterized areas are burned, those strips do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	This appears to be a medieval medical treatise in a language similar to Latin, Italian, Spanish, and French. The text describes a remedy for swelling in the eyelids that
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	When there is swelling in the eyelids, it may be caused by a variety of factors, and for this reason, it is called "grandfather's gout.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	When there is an addition of thick moisture in the outer corner of the eye and outside.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the operation on them is that it is considered proper if the increase is due to water that appears in the outer corner of the eye and is not good for all parts; and the cause of this is unknown.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore, pay attention to that fissure in the latitude, and withdraw it as much as possible from that part, and suspend it on that point and descend it as much as possible.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	If you do not see the beginning of the wound if you do not push that it penetrates the eyelid little by little, then there is no cause for this in any case.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is large, you adjust it with suture; and care for that after it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, you will not suffer badly for that, as you restore the part and make it look like skin.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the increase is declining in the parts of the eyelid, you must superficially cut those parts, and then close the opening with sutures, another that you prescribe for the beginning, and press it on the entire part, and if the eyelid is elongated due to the incision, then you will not notice any cause for this.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	When preparing for the incision, wash the hands with salted water; and care for the location that is where the blood will enter that is healthy.
Capitol .x.	The text you provided is not in the same style or language as the
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	The cure for the eye is to wash the eyelid with water.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	If gray hairs are formed in the eyelids, and especially in children, they worsen the appearance of those and cause discomfort to them; and they cannot see the clarity of the sun because of this, as some wrinkles gather around those.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And have you ever noticed that those wrinkles appear on the face all the time, and especially when they are sleeping; and then on the eyelids of those after waking up, which already have inflammation, and an increase in redness appears in the eyes; and if you touch the area with your hand, you feel a burning sensation.

When you are about to cut the abdomen, first clean the area with a disinfectant solution, then make an incision according to the shape of the white glass vessel.

E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And make sure you do not adjust in the incision so that the sweat does not reach the hole and causes damage to it.

De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	Of incision of the eyebrow and elevation of the eyelid.
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.
