E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	The second line translates to: "And its extremity is triangular and sharp-pointed." This sentence suggests that the bone's extremity has a triangular shape and a pointed tip.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	The third line translates to: "And it is made of Indian iron, and seems as if all the causes that have been said of razors and scissors and saws." This sentence appears to be comparing the quality or strength of the bone to that of various cutting tools.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	The fourth line translates to: "Of the cutting edge and the cramp of the bones." This sentence seems to be discussing the sharpness or edges of the bone, as well
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The fifth line translates to: "Whether the extremities are caused by an intrinsic or extrinsic cause, or as you have treated that corruption with those medicines and the medicine does not cure it, or sometimes the corruption arises from a member that does not feel any cause, it seems that you have inserted this member into that place where the corruption has entered, so that the member may escape from there for death or malice that is greater than the defection of the member." This sentence appears to be discussing the causes of corruption or decay in the body, and how certain treatments or interventions may exacerbate the problem.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	When the member that is affected is found, it is because it has become black inside because it is what has been burned, or if it can be properly placed inside the blackness that the puncture has made inside that member which then seizes the entire body and grasps everything; and therefore I have inscribed this.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And if it seems that the corruption is caused by a violent blow from some venomous causes, such as from a scorpion's sting or from something similar or from a nettle, and seems so.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or the blow is at the end of the digit, you should inscribe the digit and do not give space for the corruption to enter into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And if it seems that you reach the hand, you should inscribe at that of the focus of the finger, and do not give space for the corruption to enter into the focus of the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if it happens that you avoid that, you should inscribe the arm inside the cavity at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if another corruption passes and sometimes the cavity is seen, you should in that case be the death of the member; and managing another cause another in curacy is the quantity of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	When the foot seems to have corruption of the same kind as the toe, you should insert it into one of the nails.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	If you take hold of the heel of the foot, you should insert it entirely into the foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	If it may enter the hole, you should insert the cushion into the joint of the hole.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	If the corruption has already spread over the heel, you should not engage it but release it and let the body die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	The force of inserting the member or clamping it is that you stretch the tendon in the part where you want to insert it, and another tendon above it; and extend the minister one tendon to the parts further away, and extend another minister in its place; and you separate the flesh that is between two tendons, and cut it open from the inside if it is completely discovered; and then you insert or clamp it.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And make sure that there is a pause of dry cloth on all parts so that it does not touch the place where it should be adjusted and postpone the cauterization.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	If any bile accumulates when you operate, then you should cauterize the location immediately, or pause it with some powders that restrain the bile; and then return to your treatment once it is completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And tie the affected member with a convenient bandage, and care for it within the time it becomes healthy.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I advise you to go to a man in the country, this accident which you and I have reported, which occurred in the negro in the country due to an adjustment that was made for combustion of fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And this corruption first appears in the country when it is entirely applied to the foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepared himself for his operation by applying pressure to the member with great speed due to the pain and adjustment of the foot, and he immediately entered the joint, and the foot became healthy.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	Long time ago, this corruption occurred in the country's method of that indicated member.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then I won, and so you perforated the reflection of that excess which was stopped over the face of the medicine, the mercifulness of the body; and it does not reflect the excess and begins to go to another place that began in the face.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	When the doctor inserted his hand into the patient's groin, and he did not intend to do so out of fear of the repercussion of that superfluousness, and rather than feared the incision of the patient's groin, which was overcome by weariness.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	I thought that he would die, returned to his land and found that the man I prepared and incised his abdomen, and was cured.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	I have written this account not for entertainment but because it is an assistant over this matter and has significance for what is meant and followed.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Treatment of the sinus and quality of clisterization with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in the fleshy parts of the body and the abscess is prolonged because it collects sana, and it bursts and perforates and extracts the sana, and the location is identified as if it were a well, and the code that is removed from there as soft as silk, and no corruption is found in the bone or nerve or limb, it is called sinus, and no fistula is formed.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	When, however, the space is extended within which corruption presses upon some member, it is called a fistula and is not closed.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	The cure of the wound is that it is inserted into that channel as it rotates, and especially when it is finely sliced and made to resemble thread, and is comfortable so that it does not adhere to the location due to its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	If you hope that the channel adheres and that corruption is not achieved by subsequent consequences, and if there is much face in the channel, then you care for that with a clister.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And is it that you consider the sinus, and if it is large, and the breadth that you see is of bad odor, then you clister the medicament Egyptian which is of oil and vinegar and is received in parts equally, and are adjusted on the face within which the medicament is rolled out and penetrates into a specific part of honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then take hold of it as is necessary and dissolve the water and honey in it; and clister the medicament on that sinus, and stretch the incision, and place the medicine in it according to the number of hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	When it is necessary to extract that member, and it has been softened and the flesh has become thin; then do so for several days until it is fully relieved and the wound is completely healed.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	If some sores are covered with ash, and you are not able to present this medicine; and that is because you take the ash from the fire, and put water over it; and then close that and cover the sores within a short time after you know that this intestine has already been cut.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	If the thigh does not tolerate the Egyptian medicine or the ash of the fire, then close that wound with the water and mix honey with gum tragacanth, and close that wound with the honey mixture, because the property of honey is to cleanse and wash, and the sinu adheres to it, and especially when it has excessive dryness and thirst.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you make the wounds and you are sure that the intestine has become thin, then close that wound with the water and make it more tight so that the flesh is rejuvenated in it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	It is necessary to take some oil of rose and dissolve the amulet in it; or to dilute the amulet with some medicines and apply other oils that have the properties I have already mentioned in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	If the orifice of the sinus is straight and not received by the catheter of the clister, you should gradually increase that amulet until it is wrapped in an Egyptian ointment or a basilicon ointment, as it is amplified.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	If the orifice is wide, you should add the lips of the amulet to the seam and reduce the quantity inside the clister as much as possible.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	If the orifice of the sinus is elevated and causes the bowel to contract, you should dry that in a basin located in the area where the bowel comes out, so that the bowel can be returned to its original position before it is inflamed.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	If you cannot dry the sinus within the bowel, you should perforate that member am prepared for the bowel according to which it is most difficult and that it is not held in any way by the bowel.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	When you have gathered consolidating remedies that are placed on the suitable part of the body for this, extend them over the cloth as desired.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth should be as large as the communication of the entire limb; and then insert an instrument at the right side of the orifice of the limb through a hole that is ample enough for the orifice of the limb; and then extend over other cloths of the same size as the number of holes, and place it over the one per long position of the orifice of the limb so that the expansion of the bowel of the patient does not retain the large dressing only for a few days.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	Whatever is over the orifice of the limb, which remains in place for the entire time that it is placed in the bowel.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And to know whether the liquid coming from the bowel is much or little, or is digested or not.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And then you consider the location of that limb, whether in it the patient feels pain or not, and if it is in its aposteme.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	When your medical treatment is prolonged in this manner, and you see that the material adheres to the sinu orifice already, or more firmly, then you hold the wound with your hand or finger, and when you remove the plague, you change the sheet and renew the dressing.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	If the sinu has less space and subtle viruses under it, you do not despair of the adherence of it, because the medical treatment is appropriate, because in those who have a slower generation of flesh in these plagues, and in those who have the opposite of this.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if the sinu has not been well digested for several days, you know that the sinu does not adhere; and if the adherence of the sinu is delayed and is the cause of prolongation, you adjust the medicines in desiccation, and if the medicines are humid in their substance and in their virtue, they become dry as the enguent finally, when it is added to the excess of zegi.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the more you dare to cure it, is because you take of the enguent finally and it dissolves in olive oil and is over the wounded part which has an antic engual in its substance, and conforms to that, and uses that.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	When it seems to be in that way, when no brace is found, then look for a cushion, and use it if it fits well, or take a mirror and hold it up and dust it over the cushion, and place it on the fire and tighten that over the sinu; and place that am the cushion that you have found when it fits well, and dust it over drap and tighten that.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And some wounds are administered in the long-term care of the aristologia and are made with lili celesti (and lili celesti is) and flour and centaurea, and use those simple or adjusted, dust them and rub them over the cushion that I recommended, and close it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinu is prolonged and not healed by this treatment, you know that the corruption is in the preon of it, and you should make an investigation in the bones or in the other hard members or ligaments; you should treat it in a curacio fistular as it is said.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of the treatment of panarici and worn nails and incision of the finger and section.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	When the pancreas is inflamed, which is felt on the inside of the thigh or foot, and it is not found in other parts, and when it is prolonged and the curacy is most precious, or it is inflamed by an apostema cautery, or it is corrupted, and it grows between the corroded end of the ungla and the whole, and it greatly corrupts the bone that is inside the toe that smells bad, and the tip of its corruption is at the end of the said lada, and its color becomes black.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And when you have that which has been said in the division and does not satisfy your curacy, then you should know that you are completely insisted on the whole superfluity that is risen from the ungla and apply cauterization to the flesh at that place, for cauterization is not used in such a way.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If the bones are safe and the ungla is healthy, and the addicts of the ungla understand the carns at the parts that are cut, and they begin to push and ledeysso there, then you should know that you leave a subtle ray behind the angle of the ungla that punctured the flesh, and compress it inside and insert it into the flesh easily, and stop over there where the corrosive medicines of the bones are rising; and cure that which is enguentz over there where it is healthy.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	When corruption has already set in within the bones, you must cover them with the flesh of the affected part and its surroundings, as none can be healed if the bone is corrupted.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If the pain and swelling appear in the affected area, then you should mark that spot with a needle according to the size of your memory, and carefully care for that part when it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	If there is pain or swelling in the affected area and the pain becomes very intense, then you should cut the thigh at the beginning of the operation, and carefully dry the wound with a cloth soaked in hot water, and make sure that the wound does not enter the flesh that you have removed from the location; and carefully care for that place with a warm dressing.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	If the adjustment is not natural, which is common in many men, too much flesh is taken, and too much is left on the bones or too much is left on the thigh.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And the naturalness of the joint is determined by the shape of the joint, or is the origin of the joint in natural bones?
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	If that which is natural in natural bones is not bad, and the one that is natural in joints is too much.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	When it comes to those who are born lean, the incision is lighter, and if you are inserted into that part, you must do it with your own hand.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	For the one who is born in the joint's angle, the cure is difficult; and therefore, keep away from the abscess of it.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	For the one who is born in this place, you must have the nuts; cover that you are inserted at the beginning of the flesh of it, and then insert it with one of those convenient ones, and then cure it inside that which is healthy.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	Less consolidation that happens between those that are seen with the visible motions or by the nature of the man who is not yet born, or by the consolidation of plague or by combustion of fire, or by semblance, therefore, cover that success returns to its natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And pause between them the enfuses that are in the red olive per that they may not be consolidated lightly, and separate between those, or pause between those a thin layer of substance under that is consolidated after that cover.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	When it seems that consolidation has occurred in one part of the hand, then you should dry that consolidation according to what is prepared and fits the shape of the member.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	When there is a swelling (incision) of the limbs, it is called varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Varicose veins are a condition where the veins in the limbs are swollen and full of excessive melancholic fluid, which tends to occur more in the legs than in other parts of the body, especially in the legs of travelers and laborers and those who wear tight clothing.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	I advise that you administer purgation of the heart of dark-colored blood, some veins being expelled strongly, and the patient is bled from the basilar vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The cure of their wounds is second: one is to make an incision and bleed the black sanctuary, and the other hand is to raise the vein and remove it entirely.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The incision of the vein is made according to this hand: first, cauterize the beginning of the vein with a strong burning tool, so that the black sanctuary is resolved, becoming feculent in the vein, and then strengthen the vein from the thigh to the end of the incision in a small or large section, and dry the black blood in three places, and raise it from the end of the incision through the thigh, and then apply it to the wound, when the black blood is sufficient and the number of times you want, and the wound will tolerate the virtue of the thigh.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	When you have found that part, and command him to abstain from black, corrupting drunkenness.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And continue the cure with phlebotomy when the veins are filled and it is noted in the thigh.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	Then the elevation of the thigh is followed by this method: you who raise the thigh, if it is not mottled with red, and place the hand on it and massage the thigh of the tail that envelops it and the veins are exuberant; or if it is exercised by strong exercise, and the hand is not at your present, then when the member is cold.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And cut the cord on the right side of the vein in sections along its length or at its base, or at the bottom of the vein you must remove it.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And open the cord with scissors and remove the vein from the entire area where it appears in the feeling, and you must see the appearance of that which declines to black.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And when you cut and remove the cord, you see that white is the cord.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	When you have placed your hand on the elevated and swollen hip, hold it steady for a moment.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	Cut another section of that section for three days, and scrape the skin from the area where the vein appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	Raise that and insert it into the second section of the thumb, and remove that and raise it within the section that is above the first section, and remove that from the first section.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And place it within the area where you removed the pus from all sections, and insert it completely; and then insert it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	If it does not comply with your orders to extract and raise, then insert a needle made of hard steel and turn it, and remove that and insert the hand and turn your thumb over the entire area where it is swollen.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And keep that from being inserted; if it is broken, it will be difficult to raise that hand and it will come over the thigh for that reason.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	When that entire area is completely exposed, place your hand over the location of the hairless skin that is submerged in water and olive oil, and care for that entry where it is healthy.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	If the vein is obstructed due to tortuosity, which is wrapped around certain parts and not following a straight path as they have been told, then you should cover that area with your hand over the entire tortuosity of the vein and its surrounding areas, and suspend it in that way that raises it.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And remember that you have not pierced the vein and do not pressure it in that way, as it may be difficult for you to raise it; and use your caution in this.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The shape of the incision made in the vein is:
Forma de unci orp:	The form of a mallet:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not an acute angle like the fingers or a sharp end because it does not press on the vein; and it has great flexibility, which if it were subtle, would pierce the vein with its subtlety; there are too many large sizes as they have been said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Removal of the thigh vein.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the thighs of low lands as in the Ategi in Arabic lands and in the low, dry lands of India with little fertility and where there is no grass or bush.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	When the pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate other parts of the body, it is called gout by doctors.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	The treatment of the pain is caused by putrefaction, which appears as poison coming from the heart and snakes, spiders, and worms, engendering between the flesh and the bone.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	The susceptibility of the occurrence of the pain is due to this vein that happens in the inflamed area, and the place is sutured; and another comes out from the location; and another starts the vein there, which seems to be like a plant.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And when the end appears, you cover that you involve over that one a piece of a ball, which is the foot of a dragon. Enter into it, and cut off that and let the ball hang down from the wound.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	As many times as you see that by the pain has any cause in the parts of the body, cover that with a ball and cut off that.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if it is prolonged, you cover that with a part of the body and wrap it around; and if not covered that which is outside, then if it is covered and entered into the flesh and adds apothem and poyredure in the place and ulceration bad.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	When the affected part is swollen and needs to be extracted little by little, it should be removed from the body cavity and not returned to the body without causing any further harm.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	This vein is found in many men who have a certain length of palm and thumb, and I have heard that one of them is about 20 palms long.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	If it is inserted at the time of medication, insert the ray into the abdomen through the incision and pierce that long incision into the body, then remove all that is in the material and administer putrefaction to the area for several days with medicines; and cure that part with the care of bandages.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	This vein has some ramps, and especially when it appears at the joint of the foot or in the foot, and goes to that orifice, and is located under certain orifices, and is found in many orifices.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And cure that part as has been said in the division and according to what has been said here.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	From the section above, generated veins under the skin are called bovine disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This disease is called bovine malady by those who have seen it in cattle, where the hooves are affected and the legs are thin, and it spreads throughout the body and causes pain in all parts of the member until the leg breaks and comes out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	The generation of this is due to putrefaction of some humors that consist of worms, snakes, and insects, and parasites in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	When the patient is afraid of the malice of the doctor, it happens when he enters the body and reaches the head, and then goes to the chest, where he strongly pulls on the patient's breathing and enters and destroys the chest, and then makes uncomfortable movements.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	Then when you want to cure that and extract it, you should not know if you have the ambulatory and appearance of the body in sensation, and then cover that which is over him and which is further away from him, and apply it with force on him and on the limbs that are constrained and tight, and then wet it over him and extract that.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is to be pierced in the flesh and not to be removed, then you should pause the cautery on the spot where it stays, and the main cause of fear is corruption of the part which corrupts the place as they have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	If you see that it has passed to the head of the chest, then apply pressure on the overlying part with strong constriction, and wet it over him, and extract that; and cover that this body uses for the corrosion of the healthy chest by the use of medicines evacuating putrid humors, and keep away from those generating putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is common in our land, and it causes pain in various parts of the body, and it spreads from one part to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	When you have already seen that which you are now recommending to me.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to attend a woman with a foot problem in a village, and I discovered that her arm had an inflammation of a small vein in the funis, and after an hour, I saw that inflammation disappear as if silver were being poured into this, but I did not notice that it was because of the location of the vein in the location.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then, the pain subsided in that place and remained in the muscle, and it stayed like this for an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then, the other arm was corrected to pass through the other knee.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And I recommend to you that you turn your body so that you see the other side; and it is too wonderful to change the position of the limb and the speed of the member to the member.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	When you have already seen that in the best hands, following that hand, but you have seen how those who are suffering from pain want to change the position of the member to the member.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	I did not see that in the hands as it was in the woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	When I first realized that it was not something else but gout, because the woman was young, with a slender body and visible veins, and in this case, the sensation of pain was like a prickling feeling.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	It is necessary that this treatment not be apparent in those who are delicate and have humors that are not clotted with veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	When you want the treatment of the patient and they feel that pain, do not appear to you as if it has been done as they have told you, then strengthen that and afterwards remove it and press on that part inside where it is that feels that prickling sensation, and cauterize the area.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	If you do not see the wounds on the thighs, then you treat that as an exception to the heart and its expulsion of prickling sensations, and remove those unpleasant pills and serpent's gall and similar ones.
De extraccio de sagetas.	Extraction of sage.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Sage is diverse according to the species and locations on the body where it is picked, for those that have large points, petite, concave, and narrow ones, and solid ones; and of those that have three angles, and of those with tongues; and of those with stars.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	When the second member or limb is affected, two main causes are considered: the brain, heart, lungs, and intestines. When you notice that one of these organs is causing the pain, it is recommended to avoid extraction in that organ if it is not possible to save the patient's life. If you cannot find the cause of the pain, and the organ is not deep within the body, then extract it and treat the abscess.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	When the symptoms of the serum are noticed in the organ, and the bones pass through it, and the cyphal is over the brain, which is affected by severe headaches, scotomia, vertigo, and loss of consciousness, as well as inflammation and spasm of the tongue, and paralysis and permixtio of understanding, vomiting of choler, and great bleeding of the lips, and the word is cut off and destroyed by the voice, and the location of the moist wound resembles polls, and there is a sign of the appearance of the flesh at the sight of the carn.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	If you find these symptoms in your patients, then avoid surgery and extraction of the gallbladder, unless it is necessary.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	If the gallbladder is swollen in the abdomen, it is likely that it is located on the left side of the pelvis, and there are no signs of inflammation; and the movement of the gallbladder resembles the movement of the finger, and a dark color of the plasma appears, and coldness in the extremities, and sweating, and spasms; and therefore you know that death is near.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	If the gallbladder has caused inflammation of the lung and excessive sputum from the lung, and the vessels that are closest to the colon are affected, and the color of the thigh changes, and the spirit is expelled in great amounts, and there is a strong desire for air cold.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	If the gallbladder is in the membrane that is in the chest, and the pain occurs in the small costal bones, and a great amount of violent pain and spasms are felt, and not all the muscles are affected, then...
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	If you suspect that the cat has swallowed something, it is best to consult a veterinarian immediately, as some ingested objects may cause serious harm to the cat's digestive system.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	If you suspect that the cat has swallowed something in its stomach and it is stuck, or if there is any sign of plague, intestinal tissue, or hernia, and there is no hope for the recovery of the cat's extraction, it is best to consult a veterinarian immediately.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	If you suspect that the cat has swallowed something in its bladder and it is passing urine with feces, and there are any signs of disease in the parts affected by the feces, and there is severe pain in the thighs, you should immediately consult a veterinarian, as this may be a fatal condition.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	The other parts of the body are similar to those of the face, neck, and shoulders, as well as the spine, vertebrae, and joints, and they are saved when the cat does not have a vein or artery blocked and is not bitten by a venomous animal.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I recommend that you have seen the appearance of these cats, so that you can understand what to do for their treatment.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The cause of this is, for in a man there was a cessation of the flow of tears from the eye in the corner of the nose, and you extracted that out of another part, then the gray of the eyebrow, and it was healed, and did not become infected in the corner of the nose.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And you extracted another cessation from the eye that was stopped in the corner of the eyelid, then the eyelid was left with the eye, and the cessation had already been hidden and not seen from that, but it was a great cessation among the sharp sagetas of the Turks, which had a leon in the which there were no eyebrows.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the eye was healed, and it did not become infected in the corner of the eyelid.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And you extracted another cessation from the eye that was stopped in the corner of the cheek, and it was an Arabic sageta, and it was that which had the eyebrows; and then you inserted it under the guidegi, and it was already submerged in the cheek; and then you subtilized it over it, and extracted it, and it was healed for the Crestia.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	When another wise woman was asked by a man who was lying on his stomach, and thought he would not live much longer; and therefore, after forty days had passed and no change had occurred in his condition, she went over the patient and examined him closely, and he was cured, and the accident did not recur.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	I saw a man who had a woman castrate him on his buttocks, and the plague was consolidated over it, and after five years, the wise woman was in the position of the thigh.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	I saw a woman who had a man castrated in the abdomen, and the plague was consolidated around it, and it did not change in her condition, and the woman did not become barren in any of her natural functions.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	I saw another man who had a woman castrate him on his face, and the plague was consolidated around it, and the wise woman was not pregnant with pain, and she seemed to be in good health.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	I extracted the woman from the man of the first king who had been castrated in the middle of his thigh and had already passed away at the end of the day a small one, and the entire woman was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	When you were called to attend to the patient's case, it took three days for the swelling of the leg to subside.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	Then you examined the swelling of the leg carefully; then you inquired about that which was hidden, and did not feel it; but later you felt that the tip of the needle was on the ankle joint, and then you wondered if that was at the end of the leg.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	Then you examined the place where it was most painful and attractive and digestive, confident that this is the location of the leg, because it appears to me that this is the location of the swelling.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	Then you did not find any significant accident in the location that you had caused the swelling; and you continued to examine it over the days without finding an accident, and the swelling gradually subsided, and the leg of the knee joint was relaxed for several days after I felt the swelling with my hand.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	Then you stopped using the acute corrosive medicine for several days after it burned, and you touched it with your hand, and I examined that, and I found the tip of the leg subtle, which adhered to the fist.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	When you have adjusted the patient's position in the abscess for that acute medicine, after I clearly saw the tip of the finger, and it took me about four months to pass the time.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	When you saw the abscess was swollen, and could easily insert the forceps into it, and leave it there, and not allow it to become inflamed, then you did not cease to subtly and ingeniously manipulate that maneuver of the engine over that am manieyras of engens, after which I found the form of those in the neck of the capillary, and then extracted it; and then restored that abscess.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And if the doctors found that the cartilage of the nose was not restored, and you restored it and the abscess was consolidated, and the wound healed for the entire well-being of the patient, and did not return to it in any case.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recommend to you the quality of extracting some abscesses because it pauses this rule and has significance about this that I have not said, four parts of this article and the definitions of that are not understood in the narration nor do I understand those free.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	The artificer wise compares little about many things; and I think that it is present what is absent; and the novel operation and the novel instrument need the descent of the causes outside the art when it happens.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	When you say that knots are not outside the members in which they are tied, either by attraction to the place where it is wound, or by the opposite part, it means:
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	When that which is entered through the location where it is inserted, or is proceeding from the flesh, and is pulled out and re-inserted.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	If you do not obey the time required for the catheter, it is likely that you will lay it for several days until the flesh surrounding the part becomes dry and the attraction of the part and its exit are relieved.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And if it remains in the bone and does not obey your time for insertion, you will have to lay it for several days and wait for the attraction and moisture to occur on each day, and it has been re-inserted.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	If you do not obey the time required for the catheter, it is likely that you will have to perforate in the circuit of the suture on that part of the total journey until that location is amplified by the suture, and extract that.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	If the suture is in the skull and has already passed through one of the cavities of the brain, and appears in the thighs of those accidents which you have told me, you should not remove the suture and lay it back inside that it may be equal to the required time; if the suture pierces the cipher, the death is not prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	If the gout does not occur only in the body of the bone but also passes through the cipherac, and remains in the hernia for several days without any accidents occurring to it from those causes, then you should engage in the treatment of the gout and the hernia.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	If the gout is stuck and does not obey your extraction, then you should administer remedies in the circuit of the gout according to what has been recommended, and properly care for the place that has become healthy.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	If the gout is already aggravated in the location of the body and is aggravated by the sentiment, then you should investigate that am, and if you feel it, then shoot that am with the sturmentz that are convenient for the treatment of the hernia.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot reach it due to the constraint of the plague and its length, and there are no nerves or veins here, then you should apply to the plague when it is amplified and it is possible to extract the gout.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if it is held in the arteries that are sick, then you should cut the flesh in which it is stuck, and treat over that, if you cannot treat the escape of the flesh in the fracture of the aurelhas and in torssio of those that obey.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio. E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	If the basilica does not appear in a manifest way, you should believe that you are seeing it and that you are moving to the other side, or that you are surrounding some ram there; or that you are making incisions in the location of the end of the arm, where that is manifest; and that you cut it as they have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	If you want the incision of the elbow, you should cut through the stricture of the arm that touches the location inside where the location of the fingers is, and place it over the arm as you think; and then cut the brace and the vein that is cut in a concave way by fleubotomy as they have said; and keep in mind that you should avoid the percussion in the space of the artery's location.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you see that the limb is stretched, inflammation occurs in the location that you have seen as you think; and that inflammation is inflammation of the artery, so it twists.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if you see that the blood flows in the incision as wax from a child's nose, and it is a subtle rog, you should know that it is of the artery's blood; and you should cut and pause the thing said about that for a long space; and then remove the thing said, and if the blood is abscised, several veins are abscised, then stretch the arm and let go of that.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	You should guard the patient's leg from the cold, and place it above their heart to prevent it from getting cold for several days until it is healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	If the wound does not heal, and sometimes you are not present to treat it with medicine, you should incise the artery if you see that; or take a previous stick of fist, and press it on that, and hold it there until it stops bleeding at the location of the vein that is in stricture, and the pulvis for another day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And if the wound heals, then it is; and if not, you should care for that which was preceded by the remembrance of the location of the powders that flow from the wound.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And the healing of the wound is difficult in the positions that are disposed for the small part of the plague and the possibility of the vein of the arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	Perhaps the removal of the dark vein is the best way to extract the wound from the subincision of the head and to the end of the chest; therefore, which is composed of the ram of the basilica and the ram of the cephalica, as they have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	When the anesthetist covers the area over the fear in the anesthesia of the patient, it is a nerve; and then if they adjust to the puncture of the anesthesia and paralyze the nerve, it will cause the patient's stupor, and it is difficult to treat the patient, and for the patient who is not cured completely, this nerve that is seen as a sensation appears; and if it is hidden in some people and is subtle and not shown, you cover the anesthesia with your hand at the place where you perform the anesthesia and avoid the nerve with your strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	If the vein is between two nerves, then you should find the vein in length.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The advantage of the anesthesia of thecephalic vein is that it relieves the pain of the head and alleviates the maladies of the eyes.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And if you want the anesthetist to puncture in this very place, that is, whether they puncture the cephalic vein or the facial vein; then all the veins are saved, and neither the artery nor the nerves are left outside.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	However, it is important for you to perform the flebotomy that you have learned, as the flebotomy does not push the lance cap so far into the leg, and surrounds the location with a pus-like substance, and does not notice it if it is not affected by the first percussion over the same area of the flebotomy some visible signs.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	However, it is very important for you to be careful with other patients, as if you do not perform the flebotomy in the first percussion, you will not notice that apostemat in that patient.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	The quality of the flebotomy of that one and the accidents that happen to it, in which you should think about their correction.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first of them is that you know that flebotomy is not administered unless it is in conservation of health and for the hope of the patient and caution of the possibility of diseases, and that a correct flebotomy in one of the veins that are in the thigh is: cephalica, black, and basilica; and that a correct flebotomy at the beginning of the first day, after dinner, and in the autumn, and in winter when significant signs of repletion appear.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas. Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	When joint pain is treated, when it is convenient and necessary to do so, or not, at any time of the day or night, in total hours and minutes.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans. This source sentence translates to: "And when it is necessary for any woman to be dilated, it is recommended that the uterine folds be left uncut, if they have been held by a catheter, so that the veins do not excrete superfluous substances in the dilation of the uterus, which are pure and do not affect the main members.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal. E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And if you enter into baths, whether any cause does not prohibit it, or if it is exercised by some exercise for that this pain becomes subtle.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And pause the fleebotomy on the chest, as it is time for third-course dinner, as they have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.
