E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And follow the fleebotomist on a cushion that is placed either on that which will be fleebotomized or on the one that has been fleebotomized.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	When extracting the arm, and sharpen that on its own with three cuts; and then tighten the ligature around that sharp edge.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	If the stricture is tightened, whether it is tightened to the extent that it does not close, or if it is too loose, then forbid the flow of blood; or if it is softened, and forbid the body's heat.
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	When the stricture is tightened, make sure that the one who performs the flebotomy sharpens his tools between them, entering through which veins are inflamed, and they are declared by feeling.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	When the flebotomy tool is sharpened on the patient's arm with a small amount of ancient oil; and then place the finger on the opposite side of the vein, at that location where you want to perform the flebotomy, so that the vein leaks a little, and the percussion is set as far away from the vein as possible, so that the vein does not burst when performing the flebotomy, and those that are full of gas and when you stop the flebotomy on that side, you must remove the flebotomy tool; and the flebotomy does not cut the vein, and if it does, that one is tightened.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	And so, in order that this flesh-eating knife may be stopped and be troubled in all these causes.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	When you have paused the dissection, if the vein is hard in one place and then softens in another, then do so; otherwise, continue to another vein in that location or over the intestine, if the location does not become inflamed.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if the location becomes inflamed or the thigh is swollen, then you should massage it for a day or two, and do not strain the limb, as much as possible, to avoid relapsing into inflammation, nor should you enter into baths.
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And continue the dissection if necessary.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the incision is small and bleeds slowly and you fear that it may not reach the desired amount, then continue the dissection in that direction with another cut, and make sure that the incision does not become inflamed, as in case of inflammation in many women, you need less incision.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	And if the location becomes inflamed again, do not continue on it, as there is no cause for you to avoid it; and pause over that part of the blade of the needle, where the corset of the wound is, to relieve the pain of the wound.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	This place is better than oil and the others.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	Apparently, oil is used in all types of incisions during which veins are cut, and then typhoid fever or tetanus is caused when one of them is placed over the area, causing the sanc to sublimate and roll up when it becomes large.

If in the location of the incision a large abscess is generated, where watched veins accumulate, and particularly to that which has not been bled except that vein, or in the inflammation of the small vein, and you close it, and place your hand over the area, sponge infused in water and salt, a little scrubbed, and stretched for an hour, where it dissolves.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And if this is the case, then apply properly the dressing to the sanc of that vein, either in the complement of that vein or another vein.

This sentence suggests that if the sweat is black, one should apply a remedy immediately upon noticing it, and if the sweat is thick, a different remedy should be applied. Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	More often the hernia of the chest is pulled towards the opposite side of the part where it was previously attached, and it should be done on the second or third day.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	When the body is in which the wound is already sawn and sharp, and causes fever, because it is the wound of the sick person in one cut and is largely cut and amplified, the perception within what happens without sinus is pushed; and you will have preserved all the conditions of flebotomy; and you must place your hand over the knees of the patient's body, because it does not die in place of sinus, four slices are made when the flebotomizer is ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	When you want to slide the arm and evacuate the second puncture, as the wound of the vein is already closed and the pain is quite difficult for the patient, you should press with great force and bend your hand slightly, as it is too painful.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	If the cut is second-degree; or if you are afraid of the sharpness of the cut that coagulates in the vein; or if you pause over that with tyranny, or with sadness, and compresses a little the wound that is outside and out.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is gangrenous, you must open it and do not touch inside that gangrene, which is sedative.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	And if you need to make you evacuate the second puncture immediately and not excuse yourself, you should mark that over that place or on the other arm in another vein.
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	And the vein called "thigh funnel" is cut in place of the black or the basilica, when it is not inflamed or swollen, and it is composed of those.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	The quality of the incision in the foot is that it introduces its hand into the watery tail enters that the vein appears clearly.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	When you place your hand on the affected area with the tightened ligament, and then make a small incision parallel to the transverse petal, neither horizontally nor along the length.
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	Is the incision wide and is your fleubotomy the one you made on the joint of the other leg?
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of the salve is prohibited, then you iterate the leg in the water puddle and let the salve run in the water until you achieve your necessity.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	If you were in the summer days, then you would excuse the iteration of the leg in the water puddle and the heart of the salve in water for a while during the rain.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the fleubotomy of this vein is placed saved that of all the other veins, four out of five do not have a pulse, nor nerves.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the fleubotomy of the gallbladder duct is compared to the diseases of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the quality of the fleubotomy of the other leg is that you tighten the ligament or the other, placed because you have it in the water puddle, when the vein is inflamed and is demonstrated at the same time; and the incision is parallel; and if not cut in all no will be able to reach it in re.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	When preserving the joints and not finally closing them, it is customary to leave the foot bare, as the doctor will see the bones of the disrobed toes.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	Then, immerse the foot in cold water and let it run over the wound, as if you do not immerse the foot in cold water, the blood will coagulate at the vein's end, and it is forbidden to bleed.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	When extracting the blood according to the amount of need, you should place your hand over the vein or sea, so as not to solidify it completely; and it seems that you will do this in all cases straight.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	The advantage of the joint examination of that of the other thigh is that it is consistent with the diseases of the table.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And seemingly in the joint examination of this foot as you have done in the other.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	The advantage of the vein section in the joint examination is that it is consistent with the diseases of the part opposite the foot, such as the diseases of the other parts, and with retention of menstruation, and ulcers of the thighs and old changes, and with their appearance.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	The quality of the fleubotomy of the patient is that it enters the limb through the leg and covers the area where there are veins; it also makes points on the joint of the foot; and the location of the vein is apparent at the tip, and from there it follows the path that branches into the face of the foot.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	When it comes to making a cut into the abdomen or wherever the addition of the needle is needed, it is better and you need to add some salt.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	If you are making a cut on the sole of the foot, pay attention to the nerves that are still present there, and pause your incision at the point where you want to insert it, as if you were inserting it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And let the cuts be well.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	If the injection of the salve is prohibited, then you should irrigate the foot in the running water and let the salve run through that which has been evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	If the cutting tool goes wrong in the first attempt, you should irrigate the wound with a little water, at the place where the salt is; and do not fear the malicious one, rather that you protect yourself from the nerves as they have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And it seems to be a sign of another foot's engulfment.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And the location of the sciatic vein is as they have said, you need to leave the tail of the hand in the wild part of the cavity.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	When the operation of the knee is for pain in the ankle, it is done by cauterization.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	The quality of the knee operation is that it enters into the bag, and quickly and firmly tightens the thigh muscle of the wide part within four to five fingers of a long, thin needle, which does not appear except for this reason.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And when it appears, you should operate on the second leg that is closest to you and the opposite side, and it is better; or if it is incised, it is cut, and the location of the knee is left open.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And in most men it is not affected; and if you cut it, and it does not appear at the moment, you should operate on one of the thighs, and that which appears in the two feet is the one that is heard and worn out.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And keep an eye on the nerves, and run the cauterization as much as you want.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	And then loosen the stricture and hold over the location of the knee cut, where the wound heals.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	This line seems to be discussing the causes of pain or discomfort, possibly referring to certain weather conditions (ventozacio) and the nature of the affliction (qualitatz
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	This line suggests that joint pain can be caused by various factors such as corns, warts, or other irritations.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	This line indicates that joint pain can be exacerbated by certain activities or conditions, such as scraping or excising warts, and also by exposure to cold weather.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	This line suggests that the pain caused by scraping or excising warts can be alleviated by applying warm or cold compresses to the affected area.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	This line provides a detailed list of locations on the body where joint pain can be alleviated by scraping or excising warts, including the armpits, groin, chin, jaw, mandible, lips, ears, nose, cheeks, neck, shoulders, and various other parts of the body.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	This line suggests that joint pain is not caused by the removal of sinew or tendons, but rather by the removal of small blood vessels in the flesh, and that this can cause further discomfort similar to that caused by a botch. It also notes that joint pain is not necessarily alleviated by applying warm or cold compresses to the affected area if the entire body has been evacuated of waste.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	If labor pains are caused by a difficult childbirth or continue for a long time, it is necessary to administer medicine at the beginning of every month and throughout the entire pregnancy, and in the woman's private parts and at any other time it may be needed.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause is in men who, when they are called upon to perform extractions by midwifery and fail to do so with severity and vigor, suffer from weakness and trembling in their face and neck, and in their collarbone; and from weakness and trembling in the face and front of their head, and loss of color and heaviness and slowness in their limbs; and from the location of their childbirth; and from the increase of their labor pains; and from the increase of their hunger; and from the loss of taste in their mouth, or from the tongue being postponed and saliva flowing from it; and from their sleep becoming more frequent, and from pain and restlessness and other ailments that affect their appearance.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And when any of those causes are present, and especially if it is in the middle or end of the month, then you should command that midwifery be performed as soon as possible, no later than two or three hours after the day.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	When the windpipe of the neck is affected by gravity, it falls into the head and pushes down on the shoulders; this can be due to an improper evacuation of the entire body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	This windpipe is in the location of craniotomy for the head.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	It is not necessary to use that which is of complex nature or in the quality of catarrh, as it can cause great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	Therefore, it is not necessary to use those vile parts, and in the heads of those who are poorly shaped.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	What is more, if one continues to stay over it, they will lose all memory; and therefore, it is necessary that you command the windbag to pause its suction slightly on the parts left, fearing the generation of forgetfulness.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	Less windpipe of alchemical wind is in the location of craniotomy for the dark vein and the basilica: and therefore, it causes asthma, and constraint of the air and the scissure of the storm of the air, and tos, and replecio.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	When the wind is colder than usual, a small amount of it can cause weakness in the heart and stomach if left unattended.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	The wind of the cold air can cause accidental pain in the head and throat, eyes, and face, as well as toothache, and it is in the location of scalp incision of the brow ridge.

E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	The wind of the cold air can cause alcohol to be left in the mouth, and corruption of the gum, and appearance like that of diseases that are in the mouth, and it is in the location of scalp incision of the upper lip.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	May the wind that is made on the upper lip with spatula causes calidity to be absorbed by the cafathan, which is made for replenishment of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the wind of the upper lip that divides the fingers of the fire causes vitality to the scalp incision of three veins, which is of the brow ridge, black and cephalic, where that atracts the artery of all those veins pushed by the flesh, and those veins that are pushed by other veins that are fat.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	When ordering the surgeon not to perform too much incision, let the location be stripped of flesh, and then remove the nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	A wind is one that is used to ventilate the cavities of the thighs and to apply ointments to the ulcers.

Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas. Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	Finally, it is said that the entire body is relaxed and that sutures are made in the testicles of men.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And the pleasure of the wind is directed to the pleasure of the winds on women's thighs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	The quality of the position of the bellows is that it pauses the wind as soon as it begins to see and passes through with enough time, and does not prolong the position of the bellows, less pause those slightly, and return them gently, and that the humors come to the place by chance encounter.

E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	When you shave and clean the skin little by little, and consider in the position of the body,
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	When that person who has a hard skin on their rare parts, covers you with a cloth and does not put any oil on it, so that the place is not ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	When commanding the wind to enlarge the incision and make it wider, and immediately apply the necessary ointment.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	If in the sinus it becomes large, you should know that you make incisions with sharp knives, and in the first cut you should enter the subtle route of the sinus and the cavity of the body.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	Then in the second, with the examined water, you should examine the removal of the large sinus.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the sinus is very foul, you should make a deep incision in the last cut to be able to remove the dirt.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	Finally, when you want to extract the sinus little by little or in parts, one incision is enough for us.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if you want to extract more sinuses, make the incision with a larger incision; and if we know that the sinus is large, you should make the incision with a wider incision.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	The end of the incision is the depth of the cut, which is only considered.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if that of which the cut is thick, hard, dark, and the parts are straight, you should know that the holes of the winds are more open, more resolvable; if it is in summer, use olive oil or olive oil of garlic, or olive oil of comfrey, or olive oil of chamomile; and if it is in winter, use olive oil, olive oil of liquorice, olive oil of camomile, or olive oil of sinus, and those like them.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	If the superfluity is large, then cut it off, and if you want to make it look better, use olive oil, or oil of balsam, or oil of aloe, or ointment of anise, and let it be seen.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	If the ventilator is of large size and has flesh, then cover it with something that is not oil, and cover the areas of the ventilator with these locusts or with water from the sea, or with water from the bath, or with water from the laundry, and let it be seen.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And the one that has the moisture of the sand, wash your ventilators with water or with sea water and vinegar, or with any other liquid that is suitable for them.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And of the one that has the superfluity of large size, wash your ventilators with water or with vinegar and sage, which is majorana, or with decoction of anise, or with camomile, and let it be seen.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And cover the ventilator with cloth; having covered it with something that is moistened with water, and let it sleep with the ventilator.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	This is a complex medical term that can be translated as: "What should be done to allow the winding of the veins before the ventilation?
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	When you consider the beginning: if the wind or that which gives off a sharp odor is colicky and causes inflammation, then you should know that it is caused by cold things, such as acetate of milk, and by wetting oneself in the morning and evening, and by sesame, and julep, and to the effect on them.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And pause their walks as much as possible, and meat of sour animals, and condensed foods that are fatty, and to the effect on them.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And of that which causes the complexion to become dry, know that it is caused by drinking too much beer and eating, and walking between morning and evening, and using little beer and food, and stopping the walks of the legs, cannabis, piss, small animals, and columbine.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And know that in the day of wind and cold, beer is greater than food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And know that in some hours at Tyrus or Tyre's wine, or muscle medicine, it is muscle, or alcohol taken before wind or cold, or after, for that the principal members are comforted and the soreness is alleviated; and do not know that they take that scald.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	When the wounds that were made are winding wounds that have been paused on their flesh, and over the malleolus and gout, and the umbilicus in the locations of the joints, and the groin, these members do not suffer from winding wounds on them.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	It is not sought for those only but attracted to the member, as winding wounds are paused on the breast in the flow of the sac of the sac of the nipple; and they use it as that which is dissolved by ventositat freja invviscade of the member, as they pause over the abdomen and the umbilicus; thus that rare member soothes and scorches the pain that resolves ventositat.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And if it has been paused over the thighs when they have fallen into laziness or burning, then by virtue of strong attraction to attract laziness and remove the burning from that place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And it seems when it has been paused over the flesh and the malleolus of winding wounds in those enclosed.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	This winding is managed with great success, and some of them are managed with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	Some of these windings are managed with full water in the abscesses of the thigh.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And it is because the winding is full and large that water is added alone or water in which herbs have been added to make it suitable for this purpose.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of winding managed with fire: the width of the orifice is twice that which we have formed; and the quantity of the preon is the greatest of a palm; and it is in the middle of the winding, in the location where it is in the circuit, the greatest of it, the thickness is small according to the quantity that enters it a needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	The cause of the pain may be due to rogue or lemon, large margins, leon, engulfed and scattered so that it does not lead the member to its position over it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And if the cause of the pain is on the side of the vein transverse of rogue or iron, where candle is placed over the fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	When this wind is too great for that which has been recommended; and the few more of that second part of the diseases and the state of him who uses that of that.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	The winds of the elderly are more harmful than those of the young and large-chested.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	The quality of stopping this wind is to focus on the member that extends the focus of the willow leaf gently with a few drops of wax, and place it over the midsection of the thigh in the midsection of the wind, so that the focus is ignited around the end where it will not burn the chest of the patient.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And if it is placed over the thigh of the patient, and it is said that it is over the track that has been said, then when you have the winds and do not indicate that they contain the track and that the vapor is on that track, then the wind will dissolve so much.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And then uses the focus according to his own hand, and repeats it if necessary.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	The greater the wind that is administered in the disease of pleurisy, thirst, in which there is no transverse or track, and it is not administered except with water, and it is focused on the member only.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	This is the form of this: This breeze, the more it grows, the better, because it can receive a great amount of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	The text you provided is not in the language you described, but rather in Latin.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	The text you provided is also in Latin and translates to: "Blood clots have not been managed in any members except those in which there is no possibility of positioning a vent, due to their smallness, like the gums and teeth; or in a naked member, like the nose and ears, where they resemble.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	When it comes to the quality of using those that if you have found bloody discharges in the clothes of well-made shoes,
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	When the patient's limbs are stiff and they do not move, and no cause is found in the abdomen of those; and the chest is emptied at the beginning of the anesthesia and after the ventozas; and the thigh is relaxed after it has twisted; and they are placed on top of it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full and ready.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the place can be opened by the wind, it is less painful in recovery.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	However, wash the place with cold water and agua de vieira; and it will be cleaned and expelled.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the course of the sinus is prolonged by the pain of the blood vessels, and there are still residues, then place a damp cloth on it with water, and place it over it until the residue is absorbed.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the sinus multiplies, you can powder vitriol or similar substances on it, or place them over the location until the sinus has abscessed; or they are placed over the location with the feet of the vines attached to the location, and the sinus is abscessed.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	When necessary, perform a bloodletting operation, if it is possible to change those.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	If bloodletting is prohibited by suspension, then make incisions in the location where it can be safely done or insert a needle into the loci that are most affected; and let those be closed, so that when any sore appears, it does not become infected.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want to clean them, sprinkle a little of aloe or salt, or ashes, and wipe it off.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Now begins the treatment of the third part: restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is necessary for the art of medicine; and it is a restoration of fractures and accidental dislocations in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, son, wise that you are, do not cast down this chapter the faults of the physicians and the vulgar and those who for time do not pay attention to the freedoms of the Ancients nor read from those one letter.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason, this science of the scientists in our land is private; and you are not obliged to do it at that time; and I have not been able to do it, except by long reading of the freedoms of the Ancients and study on their understanding, within which I extract the science of those.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And accordingly direct oneself to experiment and study along the length of one's life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	I have already described everything in this chapter that pertains to my knowledge and the science I have passed; I put it before you now and relinquish it from further occupation; and I open it at the end of the description; and I show it at the end of the declaration; and I form it in various forms of the drugs that I administer in that, as is done by addition of the declaration, so have I done in two previous chapters.
Capitol primier.	Chapter First.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collection of the fragments of bones, from those whose preliminary release is necessary before we begin to remember the fractures and different ones of each.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, let us say in the prologue of this chapter the summary of the sermon; and the chapters for the understanding of those who at the beginning were the artisans and stood on the truth of these; so you and they who are prompt to know or learn this noble art from others.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And say that when an accident happens to any fracture or dislocation or torsion or twisting, you should immediately go to the beginning of the amputation or lay hold of that, or if you cannot, then by any means which is most bearable to virtue, or it is that which happened, or is very old, or is time of great heat, or of great cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	When the patient is well-nourished with herbs and lean meats and fish, and prohibits fatty meats and excessive intake of food that fills the veins with blood, entering if you are sure of not getting appendicitis, and if you do not fear an excess of matter in the member.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And return the patient to the first regular course that is usual for him.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And when the patient begins to be restored, you should ensure that this diet is not nourished by non-nutritive foods of fat and heavy ones in which the viscosity is found, as those that are made from flour with water, and meat, and bones, and cheese, and milk of cows, and fruits, and vegetables, and greens, and grapes, and similar ones, and this diet is made for coagulation of fractures and wounds.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	You know that bones become soft when they are in men and in the first childbirth and in the elderly, it is not possible that they continue and are solidated later in their nature by the drying of the members of them.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	When they are healed and continue to improve over time due to the drying of those parts, and they continue to become stronger and more rigid as they approach their limits, like the bones of small children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature adjusts and covers the cut ends of all parts caused by any reason, seeming like glue that grows thicker as it adheres and becomes stronger within that which is conglutinated and linked, within that which causes the strength and firmness, like fire at the beginning, within that which does not prohibit that from being one of its works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason it is necessary to stop the thighs of the patient, thighs in which gravity and viscosity and heaviness are found, as has been said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Different types of fractures occur according to the part of the body.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And you know that the types of fractures are different according to the part of the body, and a fracture of the pelvic bone is different from a fracture of the skull; and a fracture of the chest bone is different from a fracture of the other bones, it seems that all other parts are also different from each other.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	When I remember all the cases of fracture, I find that they are distinct from one another.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	There is a great diversity of fractures in their nature.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	There are different types of fractures in the bones; some are curved or angled, while others occur at the ends of the bones; and some are caused by the length of the bone: and so are the fractures of the ribs and pelvis and other parts, which can be caused by force or not, as when they are prepared to be written, and are a crack or disruption in the head, and a fissure small.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And for all cases, it is essential to remember the specifics of each fracture in order to restore them according to what was remembered in its distinct location.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	There is a lack of knowledge about bone fractures.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And for this reason, bone fractures are known: it is the tortuosity of the bone, and of that prominence that appears to the touch, and so of that when I understand it with my own hands.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	When there is no apparent twist in the location and it does not cause pain when touched with the thumb and the thigh does not cause great pain, then there is no need to fracture the bone.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	There may be twist or a small fissure, but it is not necessary to worry about that with your hand; there may be compression of the whole; there may be pause over the part of those medicines from which you remember at that moment what is appropriate for the place; and there may be stricture subtle.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	You know that this location when it is curved and not divided into two or another so that no accidents occur in its saturation, as the whole part of its comparison, if you are careful, then you should consider what happens in your time for the correction of those that happen to you.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if you have an aposteme caut, then keep that for several days until the aposteme ceases; and remove that second hand that you can lift and draw.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	You know that the restoration of that and the cauterization is done with a different bone than the one that occurred in the saturation.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then tightly tie that second one which will be the reminder of you.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	If in the os of the sagged bones, it is necessary to extend this member cut off by several parts, whether it is the foot or the heel; or if the member is small; or if several cords or one cord and the ma are needed.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And if your position is at the place where you pause the member in its natural location, while the parts that are extended from the cut-off member are being tightened, you will find that you have to return those additions to their original places and according to each hand that can be placed in their locations.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And keep in mind that you should not have your force fall on the patient's thighs due to your operation or injury; and if you find yourself in a situation where you need to apply force to one bone with another, do so according to better forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And at that time, use your force advantageously on your hand there, and if sometimes another cause appears, adjust it and cut it according to the amount of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	When there is excessive extension and compression, it is necessary to follow the example of doctors who perform surgery by making points on the surface of the body with a pointed cautery or by causing contraction in the member they have seen during the operation of their own movements.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	If the joint is connected, if the position is equal and the operation is correct and strict for that member, and if you apply a bandage and keep it quiet; put the leg on top of it and make the patient turn so that the member does not get out of its place during the night and in the morning, and see the movement and activity of the member, and have to do with all the movements of the body; wait until the position of the member is a position that ensures the pain, which causes it when it is in the disposition of the position of the member or wound; if you change the member to another position where it does not feel pain, and keep it there so that the position of that member is correct and even, so that the member does not get twisted when restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	The quality of the stricture of the member is that which you recommend; because you know that some members are different in their shape and size and form.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	When those who are small in stature, such as the arms and hands, and resemble those, cover that which is the envelope with a fine silk cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	For those who are large in size, such as the thighs and buttocks, cover that which is the envelope with a tough and hard cloth, where the lip connect the member large and strengthens it throughout its entire part, and there is no space between them.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	Then, begin to empty your bag of equacio, place the appropriate cushion over it, on the location of that fracture am three or four times the size of the member; and hold it with a small hand the lip.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	Then, place it on the part that is the edge of the location of the fracture, and hold it tightly so that it does not strain the member you have strengthened in the location of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	Then, elongate the member's envelope at the location of the fracture a little, and gradually soften the stricture, so that when you take hold of the part with a large part, it does not break.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And take another knife and wrap the other vein around the location where you want to enclose it, and see if the enclosures are at the end of the fracture; and your operation will be in the stricture of the enclosure and in the mollification of that second one that they have said in the first enclosure.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And pause between the feathers of a lion or a fox that has an engulfed tortuosity of the fracture, if in it there is a tortuosity; and otherwise, do not pause in it for any reason.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And pause over the other knife, and engulf over these enclosures that are slowly formed as much as possible, if in the location there is no inflammation or post-cautery, and you pause over it that sets the post-cautery that holds the inflammation; and lay it aside for a while; and you hold over it the enclosures.
