De curacio de anca dislocada.	Of the cure for a dislocated ankle.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	You know that the joint of the ankle and the joint of the muscle do not always mean dislocation, and do not happen to those that happen to the other small removals and concavities.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And when the joint of the ankle is dislocated, it happens in four ways: either in the parts of the fingers, or in the parts of the toes, or in the parts of the nails, or in the parts behind.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	When the joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	When you suspect that the thigh bone is dislocated from its proper place, and when you adjust the saddle of the healthy thigh against the sick one, it becomes long and the knee bends more than the healthy one, and the thigh cannot bend the knee as before, and the place where it should be pressed to apply cautery, because the end of the thigh bone has already reached here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	The first source sentence translates to: The reason for the dislocation of that which causes an accident is in the parts that are opposite, because the accidents of this are against those.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	When there is pain in the joint due to dislocation of the limb, and the swelling expands the surrounding muscles, but does not cause pain in the affected part, and if it perforates to go further and cannot be stopped on the surrounding parts; and the urine of the patient is retained and the urethra is blocked, and you must cover the limb with the ambulance over the heel.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	When the part of the thigh that is dislocated expands the nail, and it does not double over the nail that doubles around it, and the camba of the thigh is shorter than the other, and the nail is mollified, then the end of the thigh is at that place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	The first source sentence translates to: "The most effective reduction of the specimens in this dislocation is what you consider, doctor, if the dislocation is ancient and antiquated, which has already been anticipated with that administration of reduction of this and Roman second according to its disposition, doctor; and therefore, it does not seem that in that there is a true wonder.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	When the dislocation is recent in that area, and it is one of the four types of dislocations, then you should cut along the line that you saw the joint move and extend it to the parts of the fingers and thumbs, and also to the parts of the little finger and ring finger, and it will return if not requiring another treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	If the dislocation does not return in this hand, then you should prepare for strong force and extend the camber of the thumb from there, or on the side that is most comfortable for you, or on the side that is visible over the camber; and extend the end of that camber as far as the tips of the fingers; and apply strong pressure on the root of the thigh, and hold another hand on the extremity of the limb.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And if it is extension of the limb or of the finger to the angle of the elbow, or to the angle of the back of the hand.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And if it is extension of all those in a straight line when the thigh is raised and the side that is closest to the earth is hanging down.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	This method of extension is specific to all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	If displacement returns as they say, then do so; otherwise, you will need everything possible to speak about the doctor's treatment.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of the own, when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is to the joint parts, know that the thigh should be flexed over the knee; and place the limbs on the side of the thigh in the place where the head of the thigh meets the place where the knee is located; and extend the limb from the part of the shoulder to the other part of the girdle.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And if another minister forcefully takes the handles of it and makes the large opening of the patient's thigh wider and extends the parts around for a firm hold, so that it returns to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this species is used with less care than the others in which this member is reduced.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	If you are excused from me and do not obey the entry of this species of care for everything, know that the two feet of the thigh are often tied with a strong, thin limb over the ankles and over the knees.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And the length of each part is according to the quantity of four fingers, and the thigh's girdle is extended more than the other by two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	When the patient's thigh is suspended over the chin, and it is in the largest part; and the length of the thigh is the quantity of two braces.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And order a young man to cut off the head of the thigh, and suspend it at the foot of another young man, and the other young man will cut off the thigh with strength, so that the joint returns to its original location quickly.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	In the reduction, when there is a dislocation at the end of the part, it is necessary that the thigh be placed over the pug according to what has been recommended in the case; and the limb should be tightened on the real hip and on the chest of the patient.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And if two thighs are placed, one on the foot of the patient, and the other on the head; and if the thighs are adjusted to the peg that is placed over which parts are humid, so that the thigh does not get stuck because the foot is between the thighs of the patient, so that you have to extend the parts further, it will not be torn.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And every physician extends to their part, and they place the cautery in their hand and perform the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	If you follow the reduction, do it very carefully; and if not, stop gently and ask what they have said in the medical book about that tightening.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	I do not know what this means, as it does not follow the pattern of the previous translations. It may be a separate thought or a phrase that does not translate well into English.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	When the dislocation is in its place, it is important that the cushion is extended slightly, and follows this method according to the report; and the physician places the palm of their hand on the affected part, and the other hand on the other cushion, and the cushion stops the extension on the part that was dislocated.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	If the dislocation is behind, it is not important that the cushion is extended to the parts in front, and it should be raised on the ground; if there is a hard cause, ask how the pain is felt when the thigh of the patient is dislocated in the wrong direction, according to what has been said about the joint of the thigh on two sides; and the cushion is on their face and the limbs are extended, according to what has been said, it has not hurt.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	When it comes to administering compression, place the table over the location where you wish to apply the joint pain relief.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Then, when the reduction is complete - and the sign of reduction is not visible to you, and it is because you extend from the thighs, and when you see those knees and the thigh extends the chamber and expands that hole, then you know that the member that was reduced - and you adjust the thighs and stop pressing and extend a band that is not wide in any of the parts; and adhere the thigh to the supports for three days or for four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then remove the bandage and compare one chamber to another.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	If you see those knees in position, you know that the dislocation is already fixed, and then let the thigh go.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause of softening, then you return and apply that to your first stretch, and let it be expanded for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	If that is the case, and it should wait in bed for a few days until it is comfortable.
Capitol .xxxii.	Capital, Chapter 22.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	Of the treatment of shoulder dislocation.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The shoulder is dislocated by three parts, namely the head, the neck, and the glenoid cavity. The head is not dislocated.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of shoulder dislocation is that the patient commands the thigh to apply its cushion to the buttock; you should know that the shoulder is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all the limbs of the shoulder is that you stretch the thigh to the buttock, if it can reach the extended knee; you should adhere the upper part of the thigh to the face of the patient, and place the foot of the patient between the thighs of the patient; and you should adhere the shoulder of the patient to your palms, and stretch those between the thighs of the patient over the shoulder of the patient for strength, and other ministers extend the knee if the shoulder returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	When it comes to the matter of the patient's labor, his or her girdle should hold tightly to the thigh, not causing any discomfort.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And apply that and let the bandage adhere to the thigh, and apply those emplacements with a needle for three days or four, and then remove them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not use the thigh's bandage for more than a few days, until it is healed and comfortable.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	If the reduction of the foot is successful, then administer extra care with those instruments used in the treatment of the previous injury.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter xxxiii.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	Of the treatment of the dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle has some joints that can be reduced by small removal, and some have been dislocated secondarily, and the dislocation of the ankle is made or at the ends of the fingers or at the ends of the toes.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of the dislocation of the ankle is that sometimes the ankle becomes flattened at the place where it was dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	The treatment of the reduction of the ankle is of little benefit, and it is that it is extended as much as possible within the limits and then returned.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	When in the care of the patient when the leg is dislocated, take the thigh and hold it firmly in the part behind the other leg in the patient's lying position.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And if you have the second leg straight and the foot of the affected foot in front of it, hold the left foot of the other foot in front of the affected foot's foot in the cavity.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And pull the foot of the affected leg towards you and hold the left hand with your right, and extend the left arm; and push the chest of the affected leg with the other hand.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And make the necessary movements according to what has been counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And push the chest with the other hand towards the cavity.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Then if you return in one direction or two according to this manual, and if you see the foot has come out, stop; and otherwise continue the operation, making that return.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	If you are not allowed to reduce the leg as advised, place the thigh on the table over the ground, and stretch a rope on the ground that fits between the patient's thighs, and you have already covered the leg with a cloth so that the leg does not come out of the cavity.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	When the minister holds the patient's thighs, and another minister extends the foot over the patient's most or the limb that lies on the collar of the foot; and extends that same minister against the extension of the bed part, and the pillow is placed between the patient's thighs retained by it, so that this part of the bed does not extend beyond its extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	When the mason dislocates the joint with the healthier leg, and another servant holds the thigh firmly in its place, so that the dislocation returns to ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	When the dislocation returns and is declared to you as the health of the reduction, pause plastering and extend that part firmly, and tie the foot to the cushion.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And remember that you do not fear or protect the nerves that are behind the talus, so that the limb over that does not become strong and leads to strength.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And hold it for two days or three; and if the limb becomes soft, extend that part.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	When the swelling on that part appears on the third or fourth day, and forbids the patient from walking for fourteen days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	If it is not safe to walk in that space, then it is not certain that the dislocation is not over the dissolved and corrupted part, and therefore it does not receive care.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if an abscess occurs in that place, you should cover the wound with the urine of the aquatic animal we mentioned earlier, in another place of care and dressing, if it is useful.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Capital. xxxiv.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Of the care of the dislocation of the three parts of the foot.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	Cover that the one who is dislocated should be cut with little extension of its parts; and that is not difficult, it is enough to make a small cut.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	If the dislocation is in the two nails of the foot, you should cover that you make a cut on the skin or table, and it should be done as if it were not there.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And if you are in the foot, and place your hand on that part where the joints are, and then heat it with something that is not hot, and after you remove it, and see that it is cut and does not appear in the most prominent place.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then, pause the belly of the foot of the patient on a table that grabs the entire foot, which has two cups, and press it gently and firmly for three days; and then remove it and make it heal through ambulation for three days, until it is stretched and reduced in size.
Capitol .xxxv.	Capitulare .xxxv.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the special causes of displacement that are caused by pain or fracture or other injuries.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any of those causes occurs, and you take care of the patient's cure and restoration, successful results are often seen in life.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And therefore, it is not presumed that the cure of the patient depends solely on long practice, mercy, and compassion, but rather on the art, which is gradual, not arrogant or presumptuous; and it should be used at the beginning of medicine, not only for those who are in despair, but also for the alleviation of pain, and in which there is some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then you should make every effort to reduce it at the beginning of the cause, since it will eventually lead to gout.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And if the member returns shortly after you want it, administer the regimen that reduces gout and cures the plague, as is appropriate for the patient's condition.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if dislocation is mistaken for fracture and occurs in the separated bones of the pelvis, you should pierce the statement of those, and make sure that they have said in the simple ailments of this that it is preceded in the places of those.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And guard and avoid afterwards that of the intramission in the ways of fear, following that it precedes my preaching; four this is better for you to have the true Creator, and less permanent for your glory, and less salutations to the one who sees those in their time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	I hope these paragraphs of Albucasim are perfectly understood by God.
Amen.	Amen.
